column6: {'id': '315685', 'name': 'Heritance Kandalama', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 5615, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.871171, 'longitude': 80.70803, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d315685-Reviews-Heritance_Kandalama-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.heritancehotels.com/kandalama/', 'address': 'Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Heritance Kandalama 11', 'street2': 'Kandalama Lake Front', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21106'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 109, 'count2': 139, 'count3': 451, 'count4': 1207, 'count5': 3709}}
column12:
Heritance Kandalama offers an exceptional experience surrounded by nature and stunning views, making it a beautiful getaway. The staff here are incredibly friendly and helpful, which seems to be a hallmark of this place. They go above and beyond to make guests feel welcome and attended to at every moment. The location itself is breathtaking, with lush surroundings and views that seem to blend the architecture seamlessly into the natural landscape. The boat ride offered by the hotel is an absolute must-do, providing a unique perspective on the area and a peaceful escape.

The food at the Main Restaurant was another highlight. Every meal was delicious, with an impressive variety and a great balance of local and international dishes. It truly added to the luxury experience, and it‚Äôs clear the culinary team puts a lot of effort into their craft.

On the downside, there were a couple of areas that could be improved. There was a 35-minute delay in the check-in process, which was a bit frustrating after a long journey. Additionally, the TV positioning in the 317 Suite room felt awkward, making it difficult to watch from the bed comfortably.

Overall, Heritance Kandalama is a fantastic destination with a few minor setbacks, but the beautiful setting, friendly staff, excellent food, and relaxing boat ride more than make up for it.

column10: Sunny days are perfect to visit
column12:
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê Heritance Kandalama Review

As a seven-time returning guest at Heritance Kandalama, I must highlight their exceptional dinner buffet, which has consistently exceeded expectations on every visit.

Outstanding Dinner Buffet Experience
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
The dinner buffet is truly outstanding and offers incredible value for money. The spread includes:
- Exceptional variety of local and international cuisines
- Fresh, high-quality ingredients
- Live cooking stations
- Impressive selection of desserts
- Perfect balance of flavors

Value for Money
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
The dinner buffet pricing is extremely reasonable considering:
- The exceptional quality of food
- The extensive variety offered
- The premium dining environment
- The impeccable service

Having dined here multiple times over my visits, I can confidently say the culinary team continues to exceed expectations:

- Chef Sisira and Chef Danuka - You both have maintained the excellent standards I've come to expect from Kandalama. Your ability to keep the menu fresh and exciting while maintaining consistent quality is remarkable.

- Mr. Sarath (Restaurant Manager) - Your leadership in the restaurant has been evident across my visits. The way you remember returning guests and their preferences adds such a personal touch to the dining experience.

- Mr. Kasun(Captain) - Your attention to detail and the way you lead your team shows why the service at Kandalama stands out from other hotels I've visited.

The Warm Welcome That Keeps Me Coming Back

- Mahesha(Hostess) - Your welcoming smile and attentiveness make every return visit feel special. It's staff like you who make Kandalama feel like a second home.

- Mr. Prassana (F&B Manager) - Your oversight of the F&B operation shows in every meal and drink served. The consistency across my seven visits speaks volumes about your management.

The Team Behind the Magic

- Mr. Ranjith Kumarasinghe (Staff Training Manager) - After seven visits, I can truly appreciate how your training programs have maintained such high standards among the staff. The seamless service and genuine warmth of every team member reflects your excellent leadership.

- Chef Ravi Kumara- Your culinary expertise continues to impress me with each visit. The way you maintain quality while introducing new dishes keeps the dining experience fresh and exciting.

Overall Ratings:
- Buffet Quality: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
- Value for Money: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
- Service: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
- Variety: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
- Ambiance: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê

As someone who has experienced Kandalama through different seasons and occasions, I can confidently say that what makes this hotel truly special is its people. The stunning architecture and beautiful surroundings are constant, but it's the genuine warmth and professionalism of the staff that has drawn me back seven times.

To each staff member mentioned above - you've not only maintained but exceeded the high standards that made me fall in love with Kandalama on my first visit. Your recognition of returning guests and ability to maintain personal connections makes each stay feel both familiar and special.

For anyone considering a stay at Heritance Kandalama, take it from a frequent guest - you're not just booking a hotel stay, you're setting yourself up for an experience that will likely bring you back again and again, just as it has done for me.

Warmest regards,
Sameera Silva

column10: Try the sunrise from the Pidurangala rock. Hotel will arrange the transport on request. Absolutely stunning views from the top of the rock.
column12:
This was my second stay at Heritance Kandalama, and once again, it did not disappoint. We booked a deluxe king room this time, which was exactly as depicted on the website - spacious, cozy, and complete with a jacuzzi shower that made for a relaxing experience.

The highlight of our stay was definitely the Coco Spa, which was absolutely amazing and well worth every rupee; I highly recommend it! Since we checked in on a weekday, the hotel wasn‚Äôt at full occupancy, so our first lunch was served from a limited set menu. While the vegetarian options were somewhat restricted and could have been tastier, all the subsequent meals were served buffet-style with a fantastic variety and I‚Äôd give the spread a 9/10.

One of the things I love most about this hotel is how it harmoniously integrates nature into every corner, creating a perfect escape for relaxation. Although our room had a stunning balcony view of the river, we couldn‚Äôt enjoy it due to the wild monkeys.

For those looking to explore, Pidurangala is just a 30-minute drive away. We left at 4 AM, and the roads were clear, with no wildlife encounters. This location is ideal if you're planning to do the hot air balloon ride, hike Pidurangala, or visit Sigiriya.

Lastly, the staff were incredibly friendly, with special thanks to Rebecca at the front desk for her exceptional assistance throughout our stay. Overall, it was a wonderful experience, and I look forward to returning with my family.
column13: Second visit to the Heritance Kandalama!

column10: For the best bird-watching experience, head out in the early morning.
column12:
I had a wonderful stay at Heritance Kandalama in October 2024. The service was exceptional, with friendly staff, especially Ms. Rebeka, who made our experience even more enjoyable. The food was delicious, and I loved the three beautiful swimming pools available. We also enjoyed live music at night, which added to the atmosphere.

A highlight of our trip was the boat ride, where we had the chance to watch various birds. Our luxury twin room was excellent, offering comfort and stunning views. Thank you, Heritance Kandalama, for an unforgettable experience!

column12:
This place is a cracker of a hotel. From the moment you arrive and are greeted at reception, from the bar and restaurant staff, to those looking after our rooms and the guys working at the three pools, you are made to feel very special. All staff are very helpful and attentive and work hard to make sure everything is perfect. 

The bedrooms are simple but luxurious with everything that you could need. 

The building itself is like something from a James Bond movie, a complex hidden in the jungle with black faced monkeys swinging by the windows, and onto the balconies. The jungle and hotel are fused together, with much of the hotel, including one of the swimming pools, carved into the rock itself.  It is rather magical. 

We spent three days here and we hardly explored the hotel and grounds as we were off on safari and walking up Sigiria but there‚Äôs lots to do in and around the hotel. There‚Äôs a games lounge with chess boards and other board games if you want a little quiet time and there‚Äôs a decent gym if you want to stretch out your muscles after the long drives. 

The food in the buffet restaurant was excellent, we didn‚Äôt try the al a carte restaurant so can‚Äôt comment, but I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôd be great. If travelling with kids there‚Äôs plenty of choice so they can be brave, knowing they can always go back to their trusted favourites if getting a little tired and emotional. 

My only real criticism of the hotel is the bar area. The staff were fantastic, they couldn‚Äôt be better or more professional, but the bar area itself is a little soulless, it is large and somewhat cavernous which doesn‚Äôt make it somewhere where you want to linger and sip a cold beer. A really good pianist did his best to lift the area but it was a struggle for him. Some simple changes, some soft furnishings, and orientating the bar towards the views would have a huge impact and the bar could become a real hub for the hotel, where people could gather, relax and talk. 

But please don‚Äôt let my criticism of the bar put you off, this is a first class hotel, and I‚Äôd happily return for a much longer stay. And I will. 

M45, F46, S12, D8.
column13: A beautiful James Bond villain‚Äôs lair in the middle of the jungle

column12:
This is not a place to relax. Ever since I came here, the problem has continued at the reception.

45 minutes after checking in the room, when we checked the bags, they remembered that the bags were not there.

Then they ask what color and shape our bags are and how many there are. When we hear that, we feel doubt about the valuable items in our bags

After that, when we went on a dinner at restaurant the capacity of the restaurant was too high and there was a long queue out side restaurant. all they are waiting for dinner. Just like a church queue.

There is only a mismanagement of the hotel, they cannot manage the amount of guests that come for dinner . They could have increased the restaurant area or allocated time for those groups. They have no desire or concern to do any of that.

They have no desire or concern to do any of that.

We had arranged to bring a cake to surprise my son at dinner time
We told that to the hotel, so they prepared to bring it at dinner time

But they forgot that too. They finally told us after the sons left at restaurant.

I came here to relax, but I haven't found a place to relax since I came here. These are the problems.
Totally unsatisfied  stay at Heritance Kandalama hotel

column12:
We recently stayed at Heritance Kandalama and had a fantastic experience! From the moment we arrived, the staff went above and beyond to make us feel special with a warm welcome.

The property is beautifully designed, offering stunning views of the surrounding nature-truly a serene escape!

We were thrilled to receive a complimentary room upgrade from luxury to deluxe, featuring an expansive view of Sigiriya, the ancient rock fortress, over Kandalama Lake. The room was spacious and well-appointed, providing plenty of room for everyone. The kids loved the view, especially watching the monkeys play outside the balcony. We appreciated the comfortable beds and amenities, along with the eye-catching lotus decorations.

The hotel offered fantastic family-friendly activities, including pools and daily events like live oriental music sessions. It was great to have so many options to keep the kids entertained too!

The on-site restaurant(s) had a variety of options, showcasing both local flavors and international cuisine, making mealtime easy and enjoyable. They were especially considerate of different dietary requirements, providing helpful advice and information.

I would like to extend a special thank you to the staff of Kanchana Restaurant for helping us celebrate our wedding anniversary with lovely memories. A small request truly surprised us and exceeded our expectations. It was amazing! Thank you so much.

Although this is my first review of Heritance Kandalama, we‚Äôve visited several times over the last ten years, and each stay has been a delight! The quality of service, accommodation, and dining remains consistently high, making it our perfect choice and go-to destination.

Thank you very much for your great hospitality, Heritance Kandalama!!!

column5: {'id': '974467997', 'text': 'Dear Thush ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶Thank you for your wonderfully described review and for choosing Heritance Kandalama for your family holiday. We are extremely joyful to hear that your 4-day stay was an experience beyond your expectations. It truly humbles us to know that our team‚Äôs steadfast efforts to extend warm and friendly hospitality made you feel like VIPs and part of the Kandalama family. Our magical location, surrounded by lush greenery and vibrant wildlife, certainly adds layers of excitement to any stay, and we‚Äôre thrilled that witnessing an elephant drink from the river became one of those unforgettable moments that embody our connection with nature. It is a true reflection of our ongoing commitment to offering experiences that celebrate the natural beauty of this special place. We are equally glad to hear that the food exceeded your expectations and that every team member contributed to making your stay a cherished memory to recall, every time you think of Heritance Kandalama. Your kind words mean the world to us, and we eagerly await the opportunity to welcome you and your family back for another extraordinary stay. Warm Regards, General Manager', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-10-19', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}

column12:
We had an amazing holiday here, staying for 3 nights and 4 days. During our stay, my family and my brother‚Äôs family created unforgettable memories. The food was exceptional, truly next level, and the service made us feel like VIPs. Every staff member was well-trained and professional, which added to the experience.

We came here to relax and escape our stressful daily routines, and we received much more than we expected. The nightly activities, especially the dance performances, were fantastic, and my kids are still talking about them.

Room 623 was a lucky find‚Äîit offered breathtaking views, and watching the sunset was simply beautiful. One unforgettable moment was when an elephant came to drink from the river while we were in the pool‚Äîan amazing experience.

There‚Äôs nothing negative to say; everything exceeded our expectations. For the price we paid, we definitely got more than we bargained for. I won‚Äôt single out any staff member because the whole team was outstanding.

Thank you for making our holiday so special and memorable. We can‚Äôt wait to return!‚Äù

column10: Don't leave your balcony door unlocked as the hotel is in the jungle and monkeys love to come inside.
column12: Stunning views of the lake and mountains. The hotel blends into the natural jungle landscape and is quite unique. Amazing food and 3 different pool areas on different levels.  Staff are incredible and clearly love being part of the hotel. Apsara went out of her way to make sure my stay was pleasant and memorable.

column5: {'id': '973719324', 'text': "Dear Sue‚Ä¶ Thank you so much for your heartwarming review. It truly excites us to hear that your stay was such an extraordinary experience from the moment you arrived. The unique setting, surrounded by nature and curious monkeys, indeed brings a special charm to Heritance Kandalama, and we're thrilled that you felt both immersed in the jungle and pampered with luxury. We're also delighted to hear that our chefs could accommodate your gluten-free needs and that you enjoyed the special desserts and pancakes made just for you. It's wonderful that the variety of day trips added to your experience, and that our team's warm hospitality made you feel like part of the Heritance family. column6: {'id': '315685', 'name': 'Heritance Kandalama', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 5615, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.871171, 'longitude': 80.70803, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d315685-Reviews-Heritance_Kandalama-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.heritancehotels.com/kandalama/', 'address': 'Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Heritance Kandalama 11', 'street2': 'Kandalama Lake Front', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21106'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 109, 'count2': 139, 'count3': 451, 'count4': 1207, 'count5': 3709}}
column10: Definitely worth getting a Lakeview room. Don‚Äôt be deterred by the dirt road.
column12: From the moment we walked in to our suite we were extremely impressed. The setting is like no other, with monkeys everywhere, watching you through the windows. You felt as if you are in the jungle but with a touch of luxury. Some of us needed gluten free food and the chefs were very accommodating about that, making amazing gluten-free desserts and pancakes for breakfast, as well as many other foods. There is a wide variety of day trips you can go on such as Sigiriya, Dambulla cave temple, elephant safari and more. The staff are very helpful and welcoming, chatting with you about their daily lives and making you feel like family. Overall this stay was amazing, we loved it.

column12: Incredibly good experience! Saraf guided us through the booking process and helped us find the best deal for our family. We stayed for all three meals, where we enjoyed the incredibly diverse and delicious buffet. Honestly, amazing food for all three meals. The staff was amazing. Incredibly helpful and always with a smile. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous, we enjoyed the beautiful sunrise. The architecture of the place and the way it melds with nature is out of this world. We went to the Eco-park too, that‚Äôs also within the premises. Overall, amazing experience, I only have good things to say about this place.

column5: {'id': '973550931', 'text': "Dear Chris‚Ä¶..Thank you for such a lovely and descriptive review! Designed by Geoffrey Bawa, the hotel‚Äôs bird-like structure, resembling an eagle with outstretched wings, was indeed intended to amaze. We're also delighted to hear that our wide range of dishes took you on a sensational culinary adventure. The setting of our pools, surrounded by the natural beauty of the property, certainly adds to the soothing and refreshing experience, and we're glad you enjoyed it. column12:
This is a massive hotel complex in a bird wing shape - they say you walk 1km from one extreme end to the other. Various swimming pools, hotel bars, evening music, and a superb restaurant (the best hotel restaurant I had across Sri Lanka). Huuuge buffet, even outside, including BBQ, huge desserts, many curries. And all perfectly safe to eat.

I stayed for 2 nights and would definitely stay again, this was one of the best hotels I had in Sri Lanka, super choice!

column12: Our stay at Heritance Kandalama was exceptional. We experienced a beautiful piece of architecture in the hotel design, fantastic service, monkeys at our window in the morning and an infinity pool to relax in after a full days sightseeing. But the highlight of our stay was dinner with Chef Udara Sampath and his team. He introduced us to Sri Lankan cooking and educated our palettes in the  variety of spices used to create Sri Lankan curries. We were also taken on a tour of the kitchen. The evening with Chef Udara was entertaining, informative, delicious and an experience not to be missed.

column12:
Had the best culinary experience at this hotel. Includes kitchen tour, cooking demonstration and dining in the kitchen itself. This award winning restaurant‚Äôs kitchen is spotless! We were able to observe their operations during our entire meal and they are surprisingly quiet and very professional. Our personal Chef Udara and his assistant created the most delicious Sri Lankan signature meals. They made it look effortlessly easy before our very eyes and our table waiter spoiled us completely. To top it all off I was serenaded happy birthday by violin and presented with a scrumptious chocolate birthday cake. We were so full after our dessert that they kindly delivered the cake to our room to enjoy the next day (which we did! Yum!!)
Thank you Chef Udara for going above and beyond. I am, as we all are so very happy that we enjoyed this experience.
column13: Amazing culinary experience in a beautiful hotel set in the jungles of Sri Lanka

column5: {'id': '972934294', 'text': 'Dear Maria‚Ä¶ Thank you so much for your valuable feedback and encouraging comments. column10: Ask for extra towels or bath mat for the tub, it will be slippery.
column12:
Positive:
Check-in was swift, and we were welcomed with refreshments upon arrival.
The hotel had a museum-like ambiance, and the wildlife was incredible, with monkeys greeting us on our balcony each morning.

The pool, which closes at 8 PM, provided a lovely spot for stargazing in the evening.
Our room was comfortable, with a cozy bed.

The bathroom was nice, they have a bath jacuzzi overlooking the forest and wildlife. 
Breakfast was fantastic, offering a wide variety of choices.

Negative:
Where the bathroom had a jacuzzi, the shower was also part of it. You would need to climb into the jacuzzi to take a shower. This could be a health and safety issue, as it got slippery and they did not provide bath mats and enough towels, this ought to change for those guest who won‚Äôt be able to easily manoeuvre themselves into the tub.

The master light switches were behind the bed frame, this was an awkward position and not all the light worked when we first got into the room, we had to get engineers in.

Unfortunately, most of the staff (except those at breakfast) seemed quite unhappy and indifferent.

There was a lack of care in service. My friend ordered two drinks, but there was a misunderstanding, and no apology was offered. She also ordered a sandwich, which arrived about 30 minutes after my food, even though a table of eight, who ordered after us, received their meals first. Again, no apology was given. This was quite disappointing.

column10: For the elderly/physically disabled, I advice to book a room that has a bathroom with a walk-in shower, as the tub will be difficult to use.
column12:
Heritance Kandalama will always be my favourite place to go back to! It's been years but I finally had the chance to stay there again for 2 nights, and it's safe to say that they've maintained the quality of the rooms, the food, and the service. 

The staff were incredible, the buffet was awesome (we had two private dinners arranged, one for a birthday, for which the hotel staff did amazing work setting up the deco among other things). 

Had a good time in the main pool, too, and with the flautist, it was a surreal atmosphere. Overall, the ambience and the views are unparalleled!

The only tip I would give to travellers with elderly members or physically disabled members is to get a room with a bath that has a walk-in shower, as the tubs will be difficult to get into.

column12:
Our stay at the Heritance Kandalama Hotel in Dambulla was nothing short of spectacular. The hotel is an architectural marvel, seamlessly blending into the natural landscape. Our room (number 508) offered a breathtaking view of the Kandalama Reservoir and the Sigiriya Rock. Waking up to that view each morning felt like a dream‚Äîit was truly heavenly.

The room itself was spacious and spotless, and the bathroom shared the same stunning view, making it a unique experience. The buffet was the best we had during our tour in Sri Lanka. Both breakfast and dinner featured a surprising variety of fresh, natural foods, which exceeded our expectations.

The hotel is filled with beautiful art pieces, and every corridor and floor showcases the richness of its architectural design. The main swimming pool also offered a mesmerizing view, and the poolside service was excellent.

We would like to give a special mention to the Front Office Manager, Mr.Chathuranga, who was a true gentleman and made our stay a memorable one. Mr. Shanthi also went above and beyond to ensure our comfort. The front office staff, along with these two gentlemen, served us with genuine warmth and hospitality.

Overall, Heritance Kandalama is a place of tranquility, beauty, and impeccable service. We highly recommend it and can‚Äôt wait to visit again.

column10: The infinity pool at the front of the hotel only has a few loungers which get full very quickly
column12:
We stayed here for five nights as a base to explore the cultural triangle. Our booking was through Booking.com and  as is common in Sri Lanka, we paid the full amount a month or so in advance. 

The hotel is reputedly one of the best in Sri Lanka, the jewel in the crown of the Aitken Spence Hotel group. Opened in 1995, it was designed to blend seamlessly into the natural environment; in this it succeeds very well.

However, the hotel is suffering from under investment and once away from the reception, bar and restaurant areas, this is very noticeable. And the room we were given also showed signs of dilapidation: very stained loo, cracked tiles on the floor and shower of the bathroom, no chrome left on the taps, a very scuffed bedroom  floor and furniture that looked as old as the hotel. 

We booked a Luxury Panoramic King bedroom at just over ¬£200 per night incl Breakfast. The room was large with a wide balcony and an amazing view from the 7th floor of the Dambulla wing. Our King bed however was two twins pushed together with a groove down the middle (this was not what we expected or paid for), there was no safe in the room (one was installed a day later) and no physical information about the hotel anywhere in the room. We downloaded pdf files from their app but there was no pdf map of the hotel, no Beverage menu (just wine and cocktails) and no information at all about restaurant opening/closing times or which menu related to which dining area. In addition, there were no price or information at all about their main buffet dining restaurant. 

Our check-in experience was awful. We arrived just before 2pm after a very long drive. We finally were allowed to gain access to our room at 3.25pm. In the meantime we were not offered any drinks or snacks whilst we waited (why not???) so we ordered a very poor sandwich from room service for an exorbitant $15.5 excluding taxes and service charge. 

Breakfast was good although the buffet restaurant was crowded with queues for freshly prepared food and the service was hit or miss. Personally I hate buffet dining so we avoided the $24 per head (excluding taxes and service charge) and ate in their Asian restaurant which was much more personal, far less busy and the food pretty good. Imali our server there was wonderful and staff were generally good. 

Prices of food and drink are not cheap here (or indeed throughout Sri Lanka in 5* tourist hotels and restaurants). We holidayed in Japan in 2023 and found it far better value than Sri Lanka despite the fact typical Sri Lankans hotel workers earn around ¬£2,400 pa. It made me wonder if Tourists and staff are being exploited to the benefit of shareholders...

In our first 48 hours we engaged with management on several occasions. They tried to improve our experience but after multiple conversations we just accepted our fate and tried to enjoy our stay as best we could. (Writing this last sentence is not a great advert for this hotel on which the Heritance brand has been built over 30 years and which the Aitken Spence group have subsequently expanded across the region). 

At check-out, the bill for food and drink was correct but there was no recognition of our unhappiness with our stay (why not???). However, at my request, they ended up deducting the cost of that awful sandwich.

column12:
We were so excited for our stay here as part of our tour in Sri Lanka and we certainly weren‚Äôt disappointed. Probably one of the most incredible places we have been  lucky enough to stay in. The setting is breathtaking and the architectural design magnificent. 

Hospitality from the whole was truly amazing from arrival to departure. We happened to speak to Munasinghe quite a few times during our stay, he is so knowledgeable about the wildlife here and such a patient, helpful gentleman. Padmini in the gift shop has worked here since the hotel opened 30 years ago, we were so grateful to have had the chance to speak to her whilst we shopped, what a wonderful lady. We were delighted to find the homemade pineapple jam served at breakfast on sale and have bought some home; it takes us back to breakfast overlooking the lake when we eat it here in rainy Wales!

We were on a half board package, the buffet breakfast and dinner were a delight. Plenty of vegetarian options, many waiting staff and chefs ready and willing to help us. In particular we‚Äôd like to thank waiter Ravi who served us on many occasions he was so efficient yet kind and willing to chat with us when he could. 

We had interconnecting rooms that perfectly suited our needs as a family of four. Housekeeping by Sujith and Lahiru was first class, everything was immaculate on arrival and during our stay. We were even treated to towel animals which made us all smile after a busy day out and about. 

Our only regret was not allowing ourselves more time here to enjoy the hotel environment and some of activities offered by the hotel itself. We are actually in the process of booking another holiday to Sri Lanka for next summer and we are definitely going to be returning here to allow time for just that. We cannot wait to come back to this marvellous hotel and its fabulous team. Thank you all so very much!!

column12: We chose Heritance Kandalama for our honeymoon stay, but due to personal issues, we couldn't make it on our planned date. column12:
We stayed here for two nights but wished we had of stayed for longer. Its carved into solid rock & designed by Sri Lankas most famous architect Geoffrey Bawa. You really should not miss this part of the country. It‚Äôs beautiful & the hotel is a stunner. The rooms are spacious & all have amazing views. The staff cant do enough especially in the restaurant which serves one of the best buffets in Sri Lanka with plenty of choice. We loved Rasika she was wonderful & took the time to make sure we wanted for nothing on our visits to the restaurant. Interested in who we were & what we needed both for breakfast & dinner. I cant recommend her highly enough.  
Great experience & hope to go back one day. You can do Elephant safaris  from here and the landscape is gorgeous. Don‚Äôt miss it
column13: Stunning hotel in the jungle by a beautiful lake setting.

column12:
I had a special experience at Heritance Kandalama, with lovely staff.
Nalinda is super experienced about excursion, and he arranged us rental bicycle and a car charter to Ella. The driver Sana very friendly ¬†and loving nature was always keep smile and very patient, ¬†so that we can trust him and really enjoyed one day long drive. The meal was superb . The staff, especially Ms. Rasika always ¬†went out of their way to make us feel at home, and very beautiful and kind Chef Meeniam took care of me, because of my food allergy. 
When I woke up and open the curtain, I realized the world is such beautiful, I was moved a lot.

We couldn't get hot water at the first night, but that's fine because we had upgraded.

Thank you for your kind and comprehensive review. We are thrilled to hear that you had an amazing experience during your recent stay at Heritance Kandalama. The nature-inspired environment is  indeed a unique feature of our hotel, and we‚Äôre glad you appreciated the setting. We are also pleased to know that you enjoyed the entertainment activities, the food, and the hotel tour. Special thanks to you for recognizing Apsara and Rebecca for their outstanding service. Your praise means a lot to us, and we will certainly pass on your kind words to them. We appreciate your encouragement for local and foreign guests to visit not only our hotel but also our beautiful country, as we strive to restore its natural and cultural heritage. column6: {'id': '315685', 'name': 'Heritance Kandalama', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 5615, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.871171, 'longitude': 80.70803, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d315685-Reviews-Heritance_Kandalama-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.heritancehotels.com/kandalama/', 'address': 'Heritance Kandalama 11 Kandalama Lake Front, Dambulla 21106 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Heritance Kandalama 11', 'street2': 'Kandalama Lake Front', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21106'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 109, 'count2': 139, 'count3': 451, 'count4': 1207, 'count5': 3709}}
column12:
We did visit Heritance Kandalama last weekend. It was an amazing experience. The nature based environment gives a calming effect to the stay. The food was really nice. The rooms too were good. We were given the Room No 507 which is an iconic feature of this hotel as this was the room used by the famous architecture Mr. Bhawa who designed this hotel. Thanks for the Front Office staff for allocating this room to us. Also the effort taken by the hotel to have entertainment activities needs to be applauded. (Magic Show, Cultural display and oriental music accompaniments) 
Overall, the staff was very friendly and helpful and special mentioning should be done for the staff who facilitated us with a free hotel tour (Bhawa Tour) which gave us a value added feature to our stay. So thanks Ms. Apsara for arranging the same. Also, Ms. Rebeca who took us in this tour did a splendid job. She was very patient in delivering and explained everything in a touching manner. Her glittering smile was refreshing to the guests and wish her and the hotel all the very best. Finally, I request all the local and foreign guests to visit this hotel and also our beautiful island and be a part of rebuilding our nation back to its original glory.
column13: Eco friendly hotel with nice people

column12:
Great modern style hotel on vast beautiful property grounds with very comfortable rooms and a good restaurant. Service very friendly. Easy access to Danbulla attractions Cave Temple, Sigiriya and Kaudulla elephant safari park. 

Little feedback on areas for improvement - other than perhaps that the staff is very friendly but service quite slow.

column6: {'id': '10626289', 'name': 'Jetwing Lake', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1276, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.839788, 'longitude': 80.64903, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10626289-Reviews-Jetwing_Lake-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglake/', 'address': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 33, 'count4': 213, 'count5': 1023}}
column12: Our stay at Jetwing Lake was absolutely incredible! Particularly loved the tranquility that the place offered, surrounded by the most beautiful views of the lake and beyond which we were able to enjoy from our room. The room was great, spacious and kept spotless on a daily basis. Great buffets for both breakfast and dinner - quite a varied choice. Staff were also very welcoming and nice to chat with. We also loved exploring the surrounding grounds using the hotel's bikes (at no additional cost). And also worth mentioning the splendid 70m pool. Highly recommend!

column6: {'id': '10626289', 'name': 'Jetwing Lake', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1276, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.839788, 'longitude': 80.64903, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10626289-Reviews-Jetwing_Lake-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglake/', 'address': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 33, 'count4': 213, 'count5': 1023}}
column12:
We thoroughly enjoyed our 3 night stay at the Lakeside, Jetwing.
The hotel is in a stunning location overlooking a beautiful lake and is within easy reach of Dambulla by taxi.
The rooms were extremely spacious and well appointed with a stunning view of the lake (room 406).
We ate at the buffet, Chinese restaurant and also tried the bar menu. All three were excellent quality and good value.
Likewise, the breakfast buffet was good but there did seem to be an issue with the coffee which was inconsistent. It ranged from undrinkable to excellent over the 3 days‚Ä¶truly odd!
The pool was very good as was the use of complimentary bikes that we used to do the short cycle around the lake.
The location was very good with Sygiria and game parks all within 30-40 minutes.
Finally, the staff were outstanding. They were always friendly and on hand to help. The staff at the pool bar were particularly chatty and showed a genuine interest in their customers. 
Overall it was an excellent choice as part of our tour of the cultural triangle!

column6: {'id': '10626289', 'name': 'Jetwing Lake', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1276, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.839788, 'longitude': 80.64903, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10626289-Reviews-Jetwing_Lake-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglake/', 'address': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 33, 'count4': 213, 'count5': 1023}}
column12: The property was absolutely beautiful and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We travelled with our 1 year old and the staff accommodated his meal requirements. We had a lovely holiday and can't wait for our next visit to the property. The staff had also helped my husband in arranging a cake (complementary) and bouquet as a wedding anniversary surprise.

column6: {'id': '10626289', 'name': 'Jetwing Lake', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1276, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.839788, 'longitude': 80.64903, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10626289-Reviews-Jetwing_Lake-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglake/', 'address': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 33, 'count4': 213, 'count5': 1023}}
column10: I promise the best rates (very reasonable) at the spa here.
column12:
I spent a night at Jetwing Lake, so my impressions are based on a 24-hour experience. The room was spacious, larger than I expected from the photos and impeccably clean and comes with a large bathroom with separate rain shower and a tub. My balcony offered a beautiful view of both the pool and lake. The pool itself is one of the nicest I‚Äôve seen at a hotel, both long and well-maintained. 

Jetwing Lake has a strong commitment to sustainability, which is evident in their approach to amenities. Some basic toiletries, such as a comb, sewing kit, and shaving kit, weren‚Äôt provided by default. My room included a tub, but we had to call and request bubble bath essentials. These minor conveniences could enhance the overall experience.

I found the food to be somewhat lacking. All meals were served buffet-style, but the variety could use some improvement. However, the staff were exceptionally friendly and attentive, enhancing the hospitality experience.

For activities, there weren‚Äôt many options that suited my interests, so the stay felt a bit slow-paced for me. If you‚Äôre looking to simply unwind, catch up on sleep, or enjoy some quiet reading, this spot would be ideal. It‚Äôs also a good option if you‚Äôre in town for a cricket match at Dambulla Stadium.

One highlight was the spa. Run by local professionals, it offers services at very reasonable rates, which is rare even in Colombo. The service was excellent, making it a worthwhile experience.

I want to especially thank a supervisor at the restaurant (whose name I, unfortunately, don‚Äôt recall) who regularly checked in on us to ensure we were comfortable and satisfied. She, along with the rest of the team, made the stay more enjoyable.
column13: Perfect for a Peaceful or Slow Getaway!

column6: {'id': '10626289', 'name': 'Jetwing Lake', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1276, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.839788, 'longitude': 80.64903, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10626289-Reviews-Jetwing_Lake-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglake/', 'address': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 33, 'count4': 213, 'count5': 1023}}
column12: Expansive property, beautiful pool and a wonderful lake amidst immaculately clean and green lawns bowled us over during our 2 day stay. Very attentive staff that took care of special requests (Manoj especially) and Chef Ivon who checked with us everyday, the stay couldn't have been more special. Keeping Salads and Desserts in separate cold rooms made it unique for us. The housekeeping services and Reception folks all did their best. We truly enjoyed our stay here.

column6: {'id': '10626289', 'name': 'Jetwing Lake', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1276, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.839788, 'longitude': 80.64903, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10626289-Reviews-Jetwing_Lake-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglake/', 'address': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 33, 'count4': 213, 'count5': 1023}}
column10: Location is really good for sightseeing many places.
column12:
We stayed for 3 nights. The hotel is centrally located and very easy to travel to see the Dambulla cave temple, Sigiriya, Kaudulla elephant safari park, return trips to Anuradhapura and Polonnaruwa. Also it is possible to return to Colombo through Kandy. 

The best thing about this hotel is the staff and the service they offer. It was amazing. Would like to mention the following names, Tharuka at the reception, Tara, the events manager,  the staff at the restaurant,  Manjula, Pethum, Sumeddha, the guys at the 2nd floor bar, the young guy who made are room during our stay., and all the staff who made our stay really comfortable, including the resident manager and front office manager. 

The food was very tasty. The view from the rooms is amazing and was very relaxing
The pool was lovely. 

We will be back.

We visited some of the other hotels in Habarana and Trincomalee for lunch and tea and they were not up to standard.

column6: {'id': '10626289', 'name': 'Jetwing Lake', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1276, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.839788, 'longitude': 80.64903, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10626289-Reviews-Jetwing_Lake-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglake/', 'address': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 33, 'count4': 213, 'count5': 1023}}
column12:
Lovely hotel located in park like grounds on a lake. Hotel is a short drive from Dambulla town and is a lovely oasis to return to at the end of the day.
Reception is grand and open air and the dining room had one of the best breakfast buffets we came across.
Rooms are spacious and I liked the glass bottled water and body lotion good to reduce the plastics.
Food was great and staff were friendly.
column13: Stunning Oasis in a park like setting

column6: {'id': '10626289', 'name': 'Jetwing Lake', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1276, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.839788, 'longitude': 80.64903, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10626289-Reviews-Jetwing_Lake-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglake/', 'address': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 33, 'count4': 213, 'count5': 1023}}
column12:
Excellent service by staff with wonderful food & drinks by chef Kolitha & the team. Wonderful setting by the lake & sitting outside in the evening is very relaxing. 

Great to see environmentally friendly set up of the hotel from solar energy, waste cinnamon wood boiler, water treatment plant & own organic farm. 

Thank you all for making our stay very comfortable & memorable.
column13: Great place to stay, ideal location explore around Dambulla, Sigiriya & elephant watching at Minneriya

column6: {'id': '10626289', 'name': 'Jetwing Lake', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1276, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.839788, 'longitude': 80.64903, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10626289-Reviews-Jetwing_Lake-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglake/', 'address': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 33, 'count4': 213, 'count5': 1023}}
column12: We loved our stay at  Jetwing lake, the rooms were very comfortable and we enjoyed our stay , it is set in a very peaceful surrounding and we loved swimming in the 75m pool which they were kind enough to keep open past the usual hours as we were unable to swim one day. It is a good base to explore Anuradhapura, Polonnaruwa, Sigiriya & Dambulla. The food was good but not up to the usual standard which we have experianced at  other Jetwing properties , in particular Jetwing Yala where the food is exceptional.
column13: Perfect place for rest and relaxation

column12:
My parents (SL born, living in US last 35+ years) and I recently traveled to SL and stayed mostly in hotels instead of with family. Jetwing Lake was one of our favorites. We actually extended our stay by one night at the last minute because we loved it so much (and major props to the Jetwing team for coordinating the switch from one night at Jetwing Blue to an extra night at Jetwing Lake, and for coordinating with Jetwing Travel for our driver). 

All of the Jetwing hotels have excellent rooms, service, and restaurants. Jetwing Lake was extra special because of the location. It was beautiful and serene, with the lake nearby and really nice walking paths. It was so peaceful. The rooms were clean, spacious, and had a great view. The bathrooms also had a soaking tub in addition to the shower. The hotel had excellent facilities overall including the pool, two restaurants, and a little gift shop in the lobby with quality souvenirs. Also a rooftop bar which we enjoyed. 

As at all of the Jetwing locations, the restaurant staff deserve extra praise for being very accomodating for my mother's specific restrictive dietary needs. Not only was the food thoughtfully prepared, but the staff also made sure we felt comfortable and reassured during every meal and checked in with us frequently. We also met with the manager I believe who was very kind and thoughtful. 

Would have loved to stay here longer and will definitely stay here on my next trip to SL. Highly recommend, 10/10.

column12:
Gorgeous setting, great staff and fantastic food.

As you would expect, the hotel is set around a lake with mountains and jungle in the backdrop, views from the pool are fantastic.

The rooms were perfect, we just had a basic double room butt it was spacious and the decor was done nicely. Views from the balcony were also very nice. Bathroom was very clean and was enormous, probably as big as the bedroom. 

The hotel staff were fantastic, accommodating us in any way possible and very attentive.

We both had a full body massage which were good.

The breakfast and dinner was lovely, breakfast had a full range of options given the hotel was a bit quieter due to it not being in peak season, the Sri lankan options were my favourite.

For the evening they have a buffet every night, an a la carte menu, and a Chinese restaurant. The a la carte menu is served in the same area as the buffet which felt a bit odd. We chose to go with Chinese on the first night which was really tasty it was just a shame there was no atmosphere in the restaurant as we were the only ones in there for most of the meal. Second night we had the buffet which had plenty of variety, we both enjoyed it.

They have got a pool bar which also doubles up as the bar for the buffet/a la carte restaurants, and they have got a bar upstairs which is better for post dinner drinks, though it seemed very quiet again despite there being plenty of people staying at the hotel.

Plenty to do in the area for 2 or 3 days, Sirigiya rock, Dambulla cave temple, the hotel also have bikes to rent free of charge to explore the lake and local off road routes although we didn‚Äôt do this. You can also quite easily lose track of time by the pool.

column12:
As a family of four we had one of their suites and stayed for four nights. These are simply amazing - the website underplays how stylish and great they are. 
Location is quite convenient for day tours to see the elephants or temples of the cultural triangle. 
Setting on the lake is pristine, the pool outrageous but still fitting. 
Staff is super warm and service oriented, makes up with heart what sometimes is missing in English. 
They do play to bus tours, but the restaurant is spacious enough to overlook them. 
A very positive surprise and recommendation

column10: Stay at this hotel
column12:
Nothing about this hotel disappoints. I wish I had more time here. Location is great. Very close to all the Sigiriya attractions. Staff are so friendly and best part is this is a sustainable hotel. Everything is curated to save the nature and recycle.
Super clean hotel, rooms are stunning with lush views of the lake and mind blowing g sunset!!
Breakfast buffet had a variety of choices from western to traditional Sri Lankan food.
Everything is authentic and tasty. Chefs were amazing to assist us with our dietary requirements. Chinese restaurant has some yummy food options and the bar next to it has some amazing team.@I would definitely go back here.

Jetwing offers magnificent grounds with a beautifully manicured surroundings and a super long swimming pool. We booked half board and the food selection for both meals was great. 
The rooms are spacious and tastefully decorated. The hotel staff are kind, attentive and helpful. 
We stayed for one night only though we wished it was longer than that due to the excellent experience we had.

column12:
I recently took my students on a class trip to Jetwing Lake, and we had an amazing experience!!. The location is beautiful, adding to the overall enjoyment. Despite our students being a bit noisy and chaotic at times, the staff treated them with incredible kindness and patience. The students loved the ample play space, and the food was amazing with a wide spread of international buffet options. Tara, the Food and Beverages Manager (who I unfortunately could not meet in person), was amazing and provided excellent support over the phone, ensuring our comfort. Upon arrival, her associate, Mr. Sameera, made sure all our needs were met with kindness, and Pasindu, the hotel's naturalist, guided us on an informative hike.
This was the best hospitality we've ever experienced on a class trip. Highly recommended!
column13: Amazing Hotel and Hospitality. Best School Trip We've Ever Had.

column12:
We stayed at Jetwing for 5 nights and had a fantastic stay. 
The hotel was clean, stylish, and roomy, with excellent service throughout the premises. 
A stand-out employee was Jeevananthan; he went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable.  
Highly recommend. This is the best service we have experienced in a long time.

column6: {'id': '10626289', 'name': 'Jetwing Lake', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1276, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.839788, 'longitude': 80.64903, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10626289-Reviews-Jetwing_Lake-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglake/', 'address': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 33, 'count4': 213, 'count5': 1023}}
column12: Luxury Hotel surrounded by beautiful, peaceful surroundings and committed to sustainability. The hotel has excellent facilities, and we experienced first class hospitality and dining options. Most importantly friendly, welcoming and helpful staff. Thank you Mr Nalin and your team for looking after us during our stay.
column13: Excellent Hotel, beautiful surroundings, friendly staff.

column6: {'id': '10626289', 'name': 'Jetwing Lake', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1276, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.839788, 'longitude': 80.64903, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10626289-Reviews-Jetwing_Lake-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglake/', 'address': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 33, 'count4': 213, 'count5': 1023}}
column10: Stay long enough to take the sustainability tour.
column12: Amazing hotel and we loved their commitment to sustainability.  Our room was fabulous, clean and with a great view of the lake/pool area.  Pool was awesome.  Nice workout room that was also very clean.  Exceptional customer service and good food.  WE only had one night at the hotel and were very tired from our flight and 1st day of sight- seeing.  We would have LOVED to have taken their sustainability tour, but did not have the time.  The book in teh room describes the history of the Jetwing hotel chain and of the owner- which was an excellent read!  We would definitely stay here again!

column6: {'id': '10626289', 'name': 'Jetwing Lake', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1276, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.839788, 'longitude': 80.64903, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10626289-Reviews-Jetwing_Lake-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglake/', 'address': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 33, 'count4': 213, 'count5': 1023}}
column12: Hospitality at its best levels! The staff were truly welcoming and helpful. Food was delicious. Buffet offered various authentic dishes with a variety of cuisines. Main attraction of the hotel was the 70m long pool. Very good place to relax and chill.
column13: One of the best hotels in Sri Lanka!

column6: {'id': '10626289', 'name': 'Jetwing Lake', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1276, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.839788, 'longitude': 80.64903, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10626289-Reviews-Jetwing_Lake-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglake/', 'address': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 33, 'count4': 213, 'count5': 1023}}
column12:
Scenic hotel within nature. A calm and quiet environment. We went off season and it was even better this way with very little crowd.

On the downside - Due to off season there was no buffet served. However the a la carte food was good. The asian fusion food at Lu Lin is very good.
column13: The best stay from our road trip in SL (Eastern Coast, North and Central)

column6: {'id': '10626289', 'name': 'Jetwing Lake', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1276, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.839788, 'longitude': 80.64903, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10626289-Reviews-Jetwing_Lake-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglake/', 'address': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 33, 'count4': 213, 'count5': 1023}}
column10: The hotel is in a bit of a distance from the main road. We had a driver for our trip.
column12:
We had a lovely stay in this beautiful hotel.
You can have a good buffet breakfast with view of the lake. The service staff from the front desk, concierge, housekeeping and restaurants were attentive, kind and efficient. 
The Chinese restaurant Lu Lin has excellent food and the fried rice had the wok hei.
The house keeper Sampath was really attentive and provided excellent service.
I really liked this hotel and will return when I visit Dambulla.
column13: Restful stay in a Hotel with excellent hospitality, service and food.

column6: {'id': '10626289', 'name': 'Jetwing Lake', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1276, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.839788, 'longitude': 80.64903, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10626289-Reviews-Jetwing_Lake-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglake/', 'address': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 33, 'count4': 213, 'count5': 1023}}
column10: All the rooms have great views but higher floors facing the lake are nicer
column12: A modern hotel with top class service and food, set in a beautiful peaceful wooded area with a small lake. There are many majestic trees surrounding the hotel, lots of birds and other wild life, it‚Äôs a wonderful place for nature lovers. Rooms are spacious and well equipped with great views, food is tasty and varied, gym is good, pool is great for swimming lengths and the spa is excellent and affordable. The best part of the hotel is the warm, friendly and helpful staff; from room boys to pool assistants to restaurant staff to spa therapists, everyone is genuinely nice. We had a very enjoyable 2 night stay, feeling thoroughly relaxed and at peace.
column13: Calm, quiet and relaxing holiday in very beautiful surroundings

column6: {'id': '10626289', 'name': 'Jetwing Lake', 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 1276, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.839788, 'longitude': 80.64903, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10626289-Reviews-Jetwing_Lake-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.jetwinghotels.com/jetwinglake/', 'address': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Wijaya Kumaratunga Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 33, 'count4': 213, 'count5': 1023}}
column12: Our major birthday year trip and this hotel did not disappoint! Tara (F&B Manager) met us on arrival & introduced us to chef, both saw us each day. We only stayed here 2 nights and wish it had been longer. Facilities exceptional, staff great, pool WOW, food good, environment beautiful. Great place for wildlife enthusiasts, take a good camera as opportunity to get shots of rare birds on the lake is really good.

column159: Hotel Manger Mr.Nalin and the staff  were all very friendly and helpful. Food was so yummyüôÇIt was our honeymoon stay and remarkable location and nice view with the lake and natureüåøIt provides an excellent base for exploring the ancient Ibbankattuwa tank and temple,Sigiriya lion rock,Dambulla temple and many more.Villalge tour of Sigiriya, Pidurangala was an amazing experience ü§©We had a nice experience with VIP range Helicopters. column12:
It's always nice to come back to this great hotel. It has comfortable and very spacious rooms with the most amazing views of the lake.
Great swimming pool, very friendly staff and excellent service!
The dinner buffet is fantastic! The variety of foods is great, especially srilankan corner, where they serve authentic srilankan food .
Very big thank you to the staff and especially to Mr. Nalin!

column5:
{'id': '951580180', 'text': "Dear Guest,

Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience with us! We're thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay at our hotel and that we could exceed your expectations. It's wonderful to know that you appreciated our beautiful natural surroundings, the high standard of service provided by our associates, and the delicious variety of meals offered at breakfast and dinner. We're also delighted that you found our rooms comfortable and enjoyed the amenities like the spacious balcony and pool area.

At our hotel, we take pride in our commitment to environmental sustainability, and we're thrilled that it stood out to you during your stay. We believe in taking responsible actions to preserve the beauty of our surroundings for future generations, and it's heartening to hear that our efforts were noticed and appreciated. column12: This hotel was a great surprise for us. The hotel is located in the middle of paradise, where birds sing and you are surrounded by beautiful nature. The service is of a high standard, the staff are well-trained professionals. Breakfast is varied and rich, the same applies to dinner. The rooms are of a high standard, with a large bed, bright and with a spacious balcony. The hotel also has a pool area with sun loungers and bar service. I would also highlight environmental sustainability, we stayed in seven hotels during our 14-day trip and this was the only hotel that paid attention to environmental sustainability. I highly recommend visiting this hotel!

Choosing the super deluxe rooms with a view of the surrounding hills sounds like a fantastic idea, and we're pleased that you recommend them. Indeed, Sigiriya and Lion's Rock are close by, making our location even more convenient.

We apologize for the inconvenience caused by flies in the open restaurant. As we prioritize environmental sustainability, our open spaces may attract insects. column5:

column10: The pool was so nice and refreshing. We spent a few relaxing hours there sipping very nice cocktails
column12:
we stayed 3 night and really enjoyed our stay. The setting of this hotel is beautiful. You feel like you are in Africa. We were greated with a towel and a nice drink and check in was quick and alway got help with our luggage.
 The room was beautiful very clean and modern with large windows. We had a large balcony with a beautiful view. We did not like the fact that there was a drone filming around ...not very private with the large windows. I would recommend they do not allow drones near the hotel.  One night we needed towels and they never came. another night they were very quick .
The half board buffet was good. Lot's of choices for every taste. It was kind of noisy at the buffet but the staff got to recognize us and gave us our favorite table a little outside the main dinning room which was nice and a little more romantic. Staff were very polite and efficient at the buffet. I really liked the lady at the Hopper station. She was always waving and smiling ...so friendly. She got us to eat our first hopper with egg and we were hooked for the rest of our journey. 
There is a time at the evening when there was lots of insects and then there was less.  This is normal as you are pretty much in the nature there. We were not able to enjoy the balcony in the evening because of this.

column5:
{'id': '953086694', 'text': "Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your experience with us. We're thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay at our hotel and found our rooms, pool, location, and staff to your satisfaction.

It's wonderful to know that our hotel served as an ideal base for exploring the nearby attractions such as the Dambulla Cave Temples, Sigiriya, Polonnaruwa, and Hiriwadunna Village.

Your feedback regarding the buffet service is greatly appreciated. We apologize for any inconvenience caused by selections running out early and will address this matter with our team to ensure a smoother experience for our guests in the future.
We understand the challenges posed by mosquitoes, especially near water bodies, and we're glad that our fogging system helped alleviate the issue during your stay.

We're honored that you would choose to stay with us again, and we look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit to the area.
Thank you once again for your kind words and for choosing to stay with us.

Ayubowan! (May you live a long life!)

Nalin Herath
Resident Manager
Jetwing Lake
", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-05-30', 'responder': 'Jetwing Hotels', 'connectionToSubject': 'General Manager'}

column10: Take plenty of mosquito repellent!!
column12:
I booked a Super Deluxe Double Room with balcony for 3 nights.
The hotel is ideally placed to visit Dambulla Cave Temples, Sigiriya, Polonnaruwa and Hiriwadunna Village.
The room is modern, the rooms are bright and the bathroom spacious. Our room overlooked the lake and the beautiful 70 metre pool. 
The room had good amenities and the laundry service was quick and very reasonably prices.
The restaurant offers buffet style and a la carte. We used the buffet on two occasions - our only criticism is that some selections ran out quite early into service and there was either a very long wait for replacement or no replacement at all. I booked a takeaway breakfast for one early morning start and there was plenty of food in the pack that I was able to share with my driver.
In the evening there was a problem with mosquitos (to be expected overlooking a lake) and the hotel applied the fogging system to help reduce the deluge of the critters.
I would stay at this hotel again.
column13: Very nice hotel with lovely rooms, great pool, in a great location and friendly staff

column12:
Gorgeous hotel, excellent rooms and wonderful staff. Unfortunately we were only here 2 nights and one of the full days we were out touring so we didn‚Äôt get to spend as much time here as we would have liked

Check in was prompt, much needed after a long flight from the UK to Columbo and then a 3 hour bus ride. 

Chinese restaurant very good, able to cater for our severe gluten allergy with ease and although chicken and rice was ordered bought out noodles and other suitable dishes. 

The spicy chicken and ribs were divine but the pork was fatty and not very good, I think this is due to the quality of the available pork in the area as the flavours were fantastic.

Breakfast was great plenty of choice and fresh food cooked to order. 

The pool area was excellent the huge pool great for a refreshing dip and lounge in the sun. 

It was lovely watching the monkeys in the grounds up to mischief and the bar offered plenty of refreshing choices.

The rooms were gorgeous. We were in a superior room and it was huge with a big wrap around terrace and kitchen area with kettle and coffee machine massive bathroom with his and hers sinks, rainfall shower and luxury amenities. 

This hotel is lovely and was our first in the Jetwing brand but certainly not the last we have another booked this trip and currently, would actively seek out others if the brand were to further expand.
column13: Excellent wish we could have stayed longer

Your feedback regarding the impact of large tour groups and noise levels in certain areas of the hotel is valuable to us, and we will take steps to address these concerns to ensure a more peaceful experience for all our guests.

We appreciate your feedback and will use it to improve our services and facilities. If you have any further comments or concerns, please don't hesitate to contact us directly. We value your input and hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future under better circumstances.

column10: Don‚Äôt accept a room over the restaurant
column12:
Modern well constructed hotel in what appears  to be a tranquil environment.
Staff are respectful and attentive in their service. Well trained and genuinely happy to help. A highlight of the stay.
Food is delicious throughout as are the drinks (though I have avoided the carnage of the evening buffet).
My downsides are that the hotel caters for large tour groups (nothing wrong with that) but as my room is located directly above the restaurant morning and evening noise levels are excessive, even the birds and monkeys have given up.  Additionally, the nightly party on the floor above means that any idea of a tranquil night on the balcony listening to the sounds of nature setting down are a far flung dream. 
Over rated on my experience.
Not what I expected.
Would definitely not stay again,.

column12: A few days ago l  stayed at Occidental Paradise Hotel. I'm really previllged to give a review to the hotel , my one of a friend recommended this hotel, then called to book, the receptionist Nadun the phone handling, great call handling, he is really nice, supportive, he is all for what we need. Told the information ,the day we arrived at the hotel, the front team welcomed us warmly. , the welcome drink was great, we got the tamarind drink which was really nice, the dinner was great, we didn't feel like we were in a hotel, we felt like we were at home, we really felt like we were at home, really from the moment we entered the hotel and checked out. We had good support from the hotel staff until the next day, especially thanks to the receptionist Nadun who provided excellent customer service from the day we booked over the phone during our stay, he is a very friendly innocent guy. We will definitely come back one day with our family highly recommended to everyone.

column12:
Yes it's truly a paradise!

Wow what a great stay we had at the Occidental paradise!

My wife and I had a great stay at Occidental paradise recently, it was our the best stay that we have ever been. We were warmly welcomed at the front desk with an amazing and super delicious welcome drink, which was made from natural fresh fruit punch, and then we were taken to our room, where you will experience and feel the it is the paradise. You have a gourges greenery view from the room and you can see the sunrise clearly in the morning from the room, it's a very different feeling that you will ever feel. Occidental paradise location is so good, it because of the unique greenery that they have, staff was so generous, supportive and friendly, specially Hasith, Dasunika, Anjani,and Nadun they were very helpful especially the Mr. Raj FOE he was so generous and looked after us very well he was the one who handled our reservation he provided us every thing that we needed and requested. The food was so delicious and we could experienced real international buffet experience, there was so many varieties that you will never have at the other hotels and every food is so delicious, dessert items were superb and they were like no other. The service is the best, they give 100% super service to all the guests that you will never see from the other hotels. Actually it was an amazing experience that we ever had and I can highly recommend the Occidental paradise to everyone actually as Sri lankans we must ever try this luxury experienc
column13: Yes it's a paradise at awesome

column10: Amazing Stay with Top-Notch Amenities*
column12: Occidental Paradise Dambulla is beautifully located, offering easy access to both nature and historical landmarks. The staff were professional and always eager to assist. The restaurant provided a variety of well-prepared dishes that catered to all dietary preferences. Our room was spacious, beautifully decorated, and provided an incredibly comfortable stay. For the price, the hotel offers excellent value, with a combination of luxurious amenities, great food, and outstanding service. Social thanks for Raj FOE & Dulshan F&B

column12:
We stayed here for two nights and were impressed by the excellent food and the large pool. The rooms were large and had everything necessary. 

The staff was very accommodating and friendly such as Dananjaya (thanks for the super chai tea), Lakshara, Nishani, Chef Arana (thanks for the delicious omelettes), Fernando and Sarala. 

Nevertheless, we wish that the rooms would be renovated and that when we are asked for feedback and we criticize exactly this point and only this point, we are not ignored by the manager the next day.

column12:
Occidental Paradise Dambulla, an ideal place for the best hotel experience. From the time we visited the place, the staff members were welcoming and not only during the welcome process they ensured everything was perfect until our stay. Your warm hospitality felt like home and we can‚Äôt thank you enough.

Our check in process was easy and the rooms were better than what we expected. Even though the hotel is running under 4 star, the place maintains a 5 star standard. The rooms were spacious with an attic which could fit up to 6 people. What was special about rooms was its aspect with nature surrounded by trees and you could hear the sounds of peacocks and the chirps of birds.  

When it comes to food, it was top notch and the best part was there was a huge variety you could choose from. With everything in line made the experience so much better.

There were other activities you can engage in at the hotel which was icing on the cake if you are looking forward for team outings. Thank you for the hospitality would definitely visit the place once again.

column12:
This was a beautiful hotel and my chalet type room was set in well kept grounds. I was part of a tour group and so was only there for two nights.
Food was amazing with lots of choice . Staff were helpful and welcoming.
Sadly, on our second night there, the hotel had a function which had very loud music, thumping and drumming which kept me awake and despite calling reception at just before and after midnight, nothing was done. The manager told me they had had complaints from other guests too and assured me the music would be turned down and it would be finished within 15 minutes. It was just after 1 am when the music stopped which didn‚Äôt give me much time to try and get some sleep before having to be up at 6 am.
Such a shame as I would have liked to have given a higher score.
column13: Lovely hotel let down by the noise from a function

Thank you for your review.

column12:
Resort is located in a calm & scenic location. The resort itself is tranquil enough for a quiet stay. 

Pool is larger than it first appears, and there's a really nice view of the sunset from the small rock/hillock next to the pool.

Food is really excellent, dinner spread included some really good vegetarian/vegetable options, with a balanced protein options.

The resort has really good paths for cycling! It's well worth a cycle ride through the resort.

The in room amenities, specially the toiletries were really good. Loving the cinnamon lotion.

column10: Tips - Very close to lion rock
column12: We came to spend our vacation for two nights in this hotel, from the time we arrived at the hotel to the day we left, we received a lot of support from the hotel staff.we booking from Booking.Com Deluxe but they free upgrade to Duplex Category it's were amaizing room.  We were surprised. two floor in one room is supper. Wow!, room is  clean and tidy. I really want to say that we got good support from the front staff during our check in, especially the receptionist Nadun, he told us all the details of the hotel while going to the room.  We could have gone a bit far but we didn't feel far because he talked to us and explained all the facilities in the room to us.  buffet so tasty foods, we saw a lot of wild animals, peacocks, monkeys, were in the hotel, so amazing stay one of the unforgettable memory in my life, thank you so much all staff, and specially mention Mr. Ashan, Receptionist Nadun and front office team.
column13: Such a Amaizing Stay and Excellent Customer Service!
