column12:
I found a great deal on Booking.com and booked two nights here for my birthday. Since this was marketed as a 5-star hotel, I decided to splurge a bit and treat myself! I did tons of research and read every review, as I didn‚Äôt want to leave things like wifi, AC, and hot showers up to chance‚Äîespecially after seeing how some other hotels struggled with that.

Pros:
- They upgraded me‚ÄîWOW! I've never been upgraded before! I originally booked a deluxe room, but they gave me an entire duplex villa all to myself. I can‚Äôt thank them enough.
- On my birthday, they surprised me by decorating my bed with ‚ÄúHappy Birthday‚Äù written in flowers and palm leaves. After being out the whole day, it was such a lovely surprise to come back to!
- I had dinner at their restaurant on my birthday night. I was celebrating solo, but the entire staff came up, brought a birthday cake, and sang Happy Birthday. Huge thanks to Mr. Jerald, Rasika, Ishan, Damith, Dananjaya, Nishani, Lakshara, and Campiha (sorry for butchering your names!).
- Shoutout to the front desk team, especially Dhasunika and Raj. I‚Äôd see them morning and night, and it felt like they worked 24/7! üòÇ
- The staff overall were incredibly kind and attentive, always smiling. Their hospitality made my stay.
- The pool had a nice partial view of the mountain, adding to the peaceful, nature-filled vibe of the resort.
- The whole place just connects you to nature‚Äîit‚Äôs perfect for a honeymoon or a getaway with family and friends. There‚Äôs even an adventure area at the back for some extra fun with friends.
- My room was huge, the wifi was stable, the AC worked great, and there was a hot shower. The bathroom was also really spacious! Since it‚Äôs in the middle of the forest, I did see 1-2 harmless insects, but that‚Äôs to be expected.
Pro tip: Wake up early to enjoy the morning breeze, the peaceful quiet, and the luxury of being in this amazing place. I absolutely loved it here!

Other comments:
These are not exactly cons. These didn‚Äôt ruin my stay at all, just small things to note.
- Sri Lanka has short power outages now and then, but they only last 2-3 minutes, so nothing major.
- The resort is a bit off the road, maybe 10-15 minutes from the main road, but that‚Äôs part of its charm, being surrounded by nature.
- The food was so-so, not the best I‚Äôve had but not bad either. They offer buffets in the morning and evening, plus a bar. If you have the chance, it might be easier to eat outside before heading back, since it‚Äôs a bit taxing to go out again once you're settled in the resort.
column13: A perfect birthday getaway with exceptional hospitality and nature vibes

column10: Highly recommend
column12: We had an amazing stay here. The location is perfect for exploring nearby cultural sites like the Dambulla Cave Temple and Sigiriya. The service is top-notch, with staff who were always attentive and accommodating. The food is a highlight, offering a variety of local and international dishes that delighted our taste buds. The rooms are spacious, clean, and beautifully designed, providing a peaceful retreat after a day of sightseeing. Overall, this place offers incredible value for money, with luxurious amenities at a reasonable price. Highly recommended for anyone visiting the region.
column13: Hidden Gem in the Heart of Dambulla*

Mr. Nuwan, the chef, made me and my family so comfortable he used to cook special food for us separately from day 1. Big thanks to Numan and all the staff members.

The outstanding kitchen, a mix of local and international dishes, is completed by chef Nuwan  that proposes an  excellent dessert and pastries selection: for sweets lovers, it's a must!
column13: Great hotel with excellent kitchen and dessert buffet.

column5:
{'id': '972599861', 'text': "Dear Guest,
We truly appreciate your comments. Guest feedback is very important to us because it is the best way to know how we should focus our efforts for continuous improvement.

We are absolutely thrilled to hear that your stay with us left such a positive impression.

While we are glad to hear about the many aspects that you enjoyed, we apologize for the aspects of the room that did not completely meet your expectations. Rest assured that we take all feedback seriously and strive to provide an impeccable experience for all our guests.

We are delighted that you enjoyed the culinary offerings, your comfortable accommodations, and the warm hospitality from our staff members Sarala, Dilshan, Chef Nuwan, and Ashan. It is wonderful to know that the serene beauty of our gardens and the unique architecture added to the charm of your stay. Our location's proximity to the Dambulla Cave Temple and Sigiriya Rock Fortress, along with our eco-friendly practices and pet-friendly options, are aspects we are very proud of and happy you appreciated.

We are hoping to welcome you back in the future. 
All the best.

Guest Experience Team", 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-10-04', 'responder': 'Hotel- cmanager', 'connectionToSubject': 'Owner'}

column10: It's a bit isolated.
column12:
Absolutely gorgeous. 
Good food, nice room, very sweet staff, stunning trees, and lovely architecture. 
The only thing that wasn't up to standard was the finishing touches of the room. 
Special shout-out to: Sarala,Dilshan,chef nuwan, ashan.

We are delighted that you enjoyed the serene ambiance, the attentive service of our staff, and the culinary delights prepared by Chef Deepal. column12: Very nice looking hotel. Good was ok. We stayed for 3 nights. The safe wasn‚Äôt working so they sent someone twice to fix it. We got eaten alive in our cabin as there was no mosquito nets. The 2nd night my wife complained after moving the bed and finding dead bugs and even one still full of blood. They sent someone to clean, disinfect and change the sheets. The next night we still got eaten and still hurting 2 days later. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it to anyone we know.

We had a room with a private plunge pool (which was divine) but also couldn‚Äôt resist heading up to the main pool a couple of times too as the setting was wonderful. You couldn‚Äôt beat the level of service and helpfulness of staff and the drinks and breakfasts were amazing. Highly recommend a stay at this wonderful hotel!

column12: We chose to stay at Seerock for 2 nights when we went to Sigiriya. Sigiriya and Thoppigala is about a 20-minute drive from here. The staff members are super friendly and polite. The food was delicious (we had all three meals). Rooms are really spacious, clean, and tidy. We booked 2 rooms (Gajaba and Harindra) for 4 of us. One room comes with a jacuzzi, and the other one had a plunge pool. In the morning, you can hear peacocks ü¶ö calling. The restaurant and the bar are on the upper floor. You can see the upper part of the Sigiriya and Thoppigala rocks from the restaurant. The pool was clean and spacious. I highly recommend this place to anyone who loves to stay close to nature.

column12:
We stayed here with our family of fice.
Is this the perfect, European standard five star hotel? No!
But is this the perfect hotel for a short stay in the area, with spacious rooms, great food and a truly fan-tas-tic staff?
YES!
We had a really good stay here, with an excellent price/quality ratio!
Highly recommended!

column12:
We wanted to go somewhere local for our Honeymoon and somehow Seerock got added to our Honeymoon hotel lists. My wife and I decided to visit the Seerock hotel, initially we were hesitant about our choice and after going through so many reviews and videos of this place, we thought of giving it a shot.

My oh my, It was the best 4 days. Where should i start from, We loved the Hotel's architecture and the Superior King Deluxe room we stayed was beautiful with an added Jacuzzi bath . The Seerock Team was very kind to us and they pampered us throughout our trip. We got a pretty good deal with Feelo which came with Fullboard and a free Safari ride. The food was delicious , Kudos to the Chef and the Team. As a whole, It was one of the best trip we had and will recommend it to our family, friends and colleagues!

column6: {'id': '10903452', 'name': "Seerock The King's Domain", 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 263, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.999112, 'longitude': 80.745415, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10903452-Reviews-Seerock_The_King_s_Domain-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://seerockthekingsdomain.com/', 'address': 'Indigawewa Sigiriya, Dambulla 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigawewa', 'street2': 'Sigiriya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 4, 'count4': 24, 'count5': 228}}
column12:
Where do i start. It was a one of the relaxed weekends i had in a while.  I am so greatful to have stayed in Seerock which was a amazing little hotel with outstanding service to be offered. Away from city in the midst of total quietness is what anyone would ask for. 

Whoever read this review please feel free to check it out . I can 100% vouch for it.  

- Location - Easy to get by via Habarana. Once you are at Habarana you can reach the hotel via Tuk Tuk. Make sure to use Pick Me (Similar as Uber). Or you could even arrange a pick through the hotel who are happy to do the needful. 

Hotel is close to Sigiriya and Pidurangala as well which is a plus

Hotel was kind enough to arrange a Safari at Hurulu Park where we were lucky to see some Elephants at their own habitat. Tharanga (Safari Driver) was very well aware where to go so we would have the best experience. 

- First impression - We were welcomed by Shehara (Front Desk) witha big smile . Welcome drinks were offered & check in was pretty quick. 

- Room - A well maintained,  clean & luxurious little room with a  Jacuzzi built in . Belive me it was a perfect fit and its  suited for a family as well. 

- Food & Service- Chef Renuka and team are gifted with amazing skillset. Every dish they offered us was out of the world. 

Special shoutout to Daminda and Krishantha who served us through the stay was always happy to make sure we enjoyed each meal. 

Thank you Seerock The Kings Domain for the outstanding hospitality. This is the least I could do for the hospitality you offered. Looking for to see you next year.
column13: Habarana's best place to be at (‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê)

column6: {'id': '10903452', 'name': "Seerock The King's Domain", 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 263, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.999112, 'longitude': 80.745415, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10903452-Reviews-Seerock_The_King_s_Domain-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://seerockthekingsdomain.com/', 'address': 'Indigawewa Sigiriya, Dambulla 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigawewa', 'street2': 'Sigiriya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 4, 'count4': 24, 'count5': 228}}
column10: Don‚Äôt go to the hotel if you wanna try and international menu
column12:
The room with the jacuzzi is great. It‚Äôs the only good thing about the hotel other than the staff. The room is actually a luxurious room but the water pressure was not that good. Also the jacuzzi wasn‚Äôt working really well. It leaked on our first night.

Pool had no view at all and the showers and the water feature was not working at all. Several pool tiles were also broken and there were many frogs inside the pool. Also it was not cleaned properly. There was no place to take nice pictures even. They‚Äôve ample place but not maintained properly. Landscaping is nil. Also horrible wifi 

Food was the worst we‚Äôve ever tried at any hotel. Don‚Äôt get fooled by the positive comments regarding the food. I‚Äôm pretty sure they‚Äôve not tried star hotels before. The menu was horrible. There was actually nothing to choose from. Menu needs to change and also only the local food was okay. Other than that pastas was horrible. I had a spaghetti bolognese and it was not a bolognese at all. They just served me noodles with beef and tomato slices ü§¶üèæ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è 

The worst thing is we booked the hotel on full board through another app with a discount. The management refused to serve us English breakfast because we booked it on a discount. It was not mentioned anywhere at all. Also it‚Äôs very poor to treat different customers in a different way. 

The only silver lining is Shehara who tried her best to give us an enjoyable vacation but this was a disastrous vacation. 

Again what I have to say is don‚Äôt be fooled by the pictures or positive comments
column13: Don‚Äôt get fooled by the positive comments. Horrible food and experience

column5:
{'id': '945405888', 'text': 'Dear Valued Guest.
We thank you for your patronage. However ,
We are surprised to see your comments about a loss of an iPad and money. We understand that you have stayed two days at a different place or places after leaving our hotel to find that your iPad is missing. You confirmed your money was kept in the safety locker but some in your bag which is missing. 
Therefore your claim is totally unacceptable and it is done purposely to tarnish the reputation of the hotel. We have reported your review. 
We also wish to state that this is the first time someone complain about any loss of valuables in our hotel since of opening for business in 2017.
On the contrary hotel management had just returned, two days before your departure, some passports and wallet to the next hotel of another guest who had left behind in the hotel when they left. That is how honest our staff is.
We also learned from your driver that your refusal to pay his expenses incured during the stay had made you to make this false complain.
Therefore we totally reject your complain.
Thank you.
Management ', 'lang': 'en', 'publishedDate': '2024-04-05', 'responder': None, 'connectionToSubject': None}
column6: {'id': '10903452', 'name': "Seerock The King's Domain", 'rating': 5, 'numberOfReviews': 263, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.999112, 'longitude': 80.745415, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d10903452-Reviews-Seerock_The_King_s_Domain-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://seerockthekingsdomain.com/', 'address': 'Indigawewa Sigiriya, Dambulla 21120 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Indigawewa', 'street2': 'Sigiriya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21120'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 3, 'count2': 4, 'count3': 4, 'count4': 24, 'count5': 228}}
column10: Go elsewhere‚Ä¶ there are so many hotels in the same area.
column12:
Beautiful large rooms with jacuzzi that we couldn‚Äôt use as the water pressure was terribly slow. It would take 1 hour to fill the bath.
Staff super kind but they stole my iPad and $125 from the suitcase. I put all the valuable things in the safe (thank God) but left out the iPad and money that were in my suitcase (not on a desk or whatever). The staff opened my suitcase and did the job. There were 2 male cleaners who were cleaning the rooms. Just saying.
I emailed the manager 2 days later when I found out the items were missing and they couldn‚Äôt do anything about. They said that 2 days later was a long time after the departure. Really? I am on holiday and busy discovering places, I don‚Äôt have time to use my iPad every day.

Upon check out, the manager asked me to pay additional 2000Rupes for the driver‚Äôs accommodation which of course I refused to pay. Shocking. My driver had to step in and argue with the manager as this was going nowhere. Even the driver promised not to bring any tourist in that place by the way he was treated.

Worst hotel ever.

There are plenty hotels in the area.
Don‚Äôt get fooled by the price.
You‚Äôve been warned.

column10: Not for people with disabilities .
column12: Comfortable well appointed rooms , but that‚Äôs it. Despite several emails they had not adhered to our request for a triple room. The food was probably the worst we‚Äôve ever had in any resort/ hotel anywhere in the world. The restaurant can only be accessed by climbing a very steep flight of stairs. Being disabled, this was impossible . I was told that the food could be brought to the room at an additional charge of Rs 1000 each meal! There was no pool attendant and the shower and water feature at the pool did not work. There was no way to communicate with the staff from the room. No phone. We were given a daily menu with 3 choices for each meal. There was no a la carte menu. For someone who cannot eat carbs, there were no options available. Dessert was a tiny square of ‚ÄúCr√®me caramel‚Äù  made from a packet !  Disgusting ! Indeed a great shame for a hotel with so much potential.

column12:
I'm a frequent traveler and I was tempted to try out this hotel as I came across one of their offers. I called the hotel and checked their availability and placed a temporary booking. Then I confirmed the offer and made the payment and requested them to send the booking confirmation. 

I had been trying for 3 days to get a booking confirmation from them!!! But still had NO success. I travel a quite a lot and sending a booking confirmation is a matter of few minutes usually. I was surprised why it is taking them days to send a simple booking confirmation. I have made more than 10 calls over the past 3 days to ask for the booking. Also, to my surprise I found that the last few calls made to the landline were intentionally picked up and cancelled. (This is a FIRST in many of my travels).

Also, I had the feeling that the first female agent who picked up the reservation was clueless. She was not good in her English, so I spoke to her in Sinhalese. Whenever I inquired about the booking she will reply saying it will be sent shortly. But it never came in the first 3 days. What a waste of time!

Finally on the fourth day another reservation executive picks up the call and sends me a booking for a different set of days. I tried to call and ask them to correct it. But the hotel never picked up any of their phones.

So i finally decided to cancel the booking. 
I'm sure they have made a Blunder somewhere!!!
hence this reaction! 
I have seen hotels make mistakes before but the quality hotels always try to make amends and will usually try to check with the customer and correct it. This is a good sign of the lack of quality and lack of training of the staff. If the staff is this negligent and rude even prior to your arrival, I'm glad I didn't go there to find out!
column13: Terrible Customer Service / Guest Handling / Not reliable

column12: We stayed at The King‚Äôs Domain last December and had an absolutely wonderful experience. We stayed there two nights. column10: Don‚Äôt bother booking here
column12:
We booked into Liyya Water Villa‚Äôs for 5 nights in July with high expectations for the opportunity to relax for a day or two after a busy holiday.
On first impressions the villas are in an idyllic but very remote location which could be very peaceful.  Without any prior notice, we were subject to building work being completed in public areas. 3 feet away from the swimming pool/sunbeds and staff telling us they would be just unloading the truck, then half an hours work which after 2 hours they were still there. To then being told they would be 20mins. While this work was being done there was wood constantly being sawed, drilling and staple gunning. The men were video calling. Which in my swimwear made me very uncomfortable by the pool.
Alongside this the showers in our room were freezing cold and the internet didn‚Äôt work which made planning and booking anything for our trip impossible from our room or reception.
The food was average at best with little to no choice for breakfast. Which would make it very difficult if you were intolerant/vegetarian or vegan. 
Because of the remote location and area there is very little choice for food locally. So you are stuck at the restaurant in an evening again with little choice and one food menu per table, no matter your table size. With no drinks menu.
Liyya has the potential to be wonderful but has a long way to go to be 5 stars.
We were promised a refund for the 3 nights that we didn‚Äôt stay. And in October we are still waiting for our money back.
column13: That bad we booked a new hotel

column12:
We had a group booking for about 55 people at Liyya Water Villa in Dambulla on June 8th and 9th, 2024, to celebrate our office's 10th anniversary. Our stay was wonderful, and we‚Äôre so glad we picked this place for our special celebration.
The food was amazing, with a great variety, and everything tasted delicious. The restaurant manager was very professional and helpful, making sure we had everything we needed. The front desk staff were also friendly and flexible. They gave us a warm welcome, which made us feel special right from the start.
Thank you to the Liyya team for making everything so easy and enjoyable. I highly recommend Liyya Water Villa for anyone looking for a great place to stay with excellent food and service.

column10: Minor imperfections but take them in your stride and simply enjoy!
column12: This hotel was the second on our recent tour of Sri Lanka and it was really lovely.  The design of the rooms around a central lake is charming with ducks and even a large Iguana type lizard.  Not to forget the monkeys of course that kept the staff busy chasing them away from the dining areas.  It's not just to lay-out that impresses but the rooms too.  They are modern, large and comfortable in every way.  Ours, the furthest away from the dining room and pool had a great view back towards the reception.  The staff were really thoughtful and helpful and the food was always exceptional.  Great place and wonderful memories.

column10: Check your locker thoroughly before you check out !!
column12: We stayed ay Liyya Water Villas for 3 nights recently on our tour of SriLanka...We had booked 05 Villas...rooms were spacious & clean ...Check in was smooth...Ambience was fab with a big pond in the center with friendly ducks...Food was yummy...I had left behind my credit & debit cards by mistake in my room 103 in the locker & moved to the next destination with my friends...they contacted me with photo of my cards & on my request immediately couriered the cards to our Travel Agents in Colombo who handed over the cards to me on receipt....Iam Grateful for the quick & efficient response from hotel team

column12:
I had a pleasant stay at Liyya water villa and I‚Äôd like to express my gratitude to the staff for their outstanding hospitality. From the moment I arrived, the team was warm, welcoming, and always ready to help with any request. Special thanks to Mr. Rathnayaka and Anusha in restaurant , Samanthi in room maintenance and Hashini the receptionist for going the extra mile to ensure I had everything I needed.

The room was clean, comfortable, and well-maintained, which made my stay enjoyable. The location was also perfect and I appreciated the convenience of nearby attractions.

However, I believe there‚Äôs some room for improvement in the food section.I felt that the variety and freshness of some items could be enhanced. A bit more attention to the quality of ingredients and perhaps expanding the menu would really elevate the dining experience.

Overall, I had a great stay, and I look forward to visiting again. Thank you to the entire team for making my trip memorable!

column10: Wonderful stay!
column12: This is a beautiful, luxurious hotel in a peaceful location. The rooms are wonderful with modern interiors, and the setting is picturesque as all of the villas face into a pretty lake. There are plenty of friendly birds to see in the surroundings, and you can swim in the pool while having a magnificent view of the lake. Food is delicious with plenty of choice on offer (both Sri Lankan and western) and staff are  brilliantly supportive ensuring that guests are happy and content. It was a truly unforgettable stay for myself and my family and we look forward to our next magical visit to Liyya Water Villas!

column6: {'id': '12059634', 'name': 'Liyya Water Villas', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 349, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.784759, 'longitude': 80.64743, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d12059634-Reviews-Liyya_Water_Villas-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://web.facebook.com/liyyawatervillas/?_rdc=1&_rdr', 'address': 'Embulambe, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Embulambe', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 51, 'count5': 276}}
column12: The villas were stunning.  Beautiful architecture.  Absolutely amazing location around a small lake with ducks about it. Pool was great with the family. We had drinks by the pool all to ourselves. Was a great base to go to sigiriya, to dambullah caves and the elephant safari was fantastic. Loved it here. And even a chess board in the room to play a few games. The staff were very friendly and helpful - Ratnayake was very attentive and helpful at the restaurant through out. A great place to stay.
column13: Stunning villas around a lake and pool

column12:
Our stay at Liyya Water Villas was short but delightful! From the moment we arrived, we were warmly welcomed by Susantha, who went out of his way to ensure our comfort. Dinner was a quiet affair, but the Sri Lankan food was some of the best we had on our entire trip‚Äîan authentic feast bursting with incredible flavors.

Our room was impressively spacious, featuring a super comfy bed and a charming outdoor seating area where we were greeted by adorable local wildlife, including ducks and friendly dogs. The place had a wonderfully homely and safe vibe, making our stay truly special.

column6: {'id': '12059634', 'name': 'Liyya Water Villas', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 349, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.784759, 'longitude': 80.64743, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d12059634-Reviews-Liyya_Water_Villas-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://web.facebook.com/liyyawatervillas/?_rdc=1&_rdr', 'address': 'Embulambe, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Embulambe', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 9, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 51, 'count5': 276}}
column10: Get up early morning and come to the ground you can watch many birds and hear their calls
column12: Sigiriya and Dabulla is a very beautiful tourist paradise in Sri Lanka, my daughter, son and wife stayed at Liyya Water Villa for one day and I was very surprised when I saw this hotel while driving along a gravel road surrounded by forest. All the trees and plants at the hotel were growing with proper nutrition. Well maintained lake with tamed ducks gives a fabulous look. We were greeted at the entrance by the friendly receptionists Hashani and Nisansala, it is a extrem welcome. A highly maintained family room  was provided for the family with two king size beds and luxurious ameities.  Tremendous effort had taken by house keepers to maintained the washrooms in mint conditions and it is not an easy task with area provincial water but they have done, housekeeping staff were very friendly and well-trained, especially Ratnayake and Samanthi among them. The food was prepared and presented at a very high level and delicious, it is a very beautiful and high standard hotel, all this credit should go to the General Manager, Mr. Mahesh Dhammapathfor his bold leadership so I hereby give my respect to him. If anyone travels Sigiriya this is the no 01 hotel to stay to get plus plus experience which you never get it from anyone.... All the very best Mahesh and the team.
column13: One of the best friendly staff, well maintained environment with tantalizing food and best place to stay.

column12:
My wife and I had a wonderful stay at Liyya Water Villas. The staff were fantastic, greeting us warmly right from the entrance. The security personnel, front desk, room service, and restaurant staff were all exceptionally courteous and professional.

The hotel itself is very calm, and our cabana room offered good privacy. The presence of friendly ducks around the property added a delightful touch to the experience. The food was excellent, with a good variety to choose from, and the swimming pool was also great.

However, I feel there could be some additional activities available at the hotel. It would be nice to have options such as bicycle rides, a spa, gym, library, and maybe an indoor game area.

Additionally, the rooms could be improved with a larger TV, and the bathroom would benefit from having a bathtub.

Overall, it was a lovely stay, and we look forward to seeing these enhancements in the future.
column13: Great Experience, but Room for Improvement

column12:
The little cottages by the side of a little lake occupied by little creatures like ducks was the first thing that made me decide on the venue. 
The warmest welcome and the comfy surrounding helped us settle down really fast. 
The swing by the lake and the narrow path on which my little girl rode her bicycle gave the perfect entertainment for her.
A stay is never complete without a splash in the pool. The pool has a picturesque setting and ideal for perfect pictures. 
If looking for a serene place to relax and calm down from the chaotic busy schedules, this is an idea destination!!!
column13: A day by a little lake!

It is one of the best places we have ever stayed! Amazing architecture. We stayed at Bakmee Upper and Lower Chalet. Kayaking was an amazing experience specifically in the lake with lots of trees. The food was good, and they prepared separate small meals for the kids too. Friendly staff. Very spacious rooms and washrooms. Comfortable beds. The plunge pool with a jacuzzi is nice; wish it was a little bigger pool. Lots of peacocks and many birds can be seen.
Highly recommend. Admirable place.

column6: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}
column12:
The concept of the hotel as a retreat is very nice. Huuuge property with beautiful nature everywhere you look, which you can explore by the free-to-use bikes they offer. The view from our room into the nature and to tge mountain was beautiful.  We liked the architecture of the rooms and the restaurant area with the window facades. We also liked that there was no music in the restaurant area to be able to enjoy the sound of the wind, trees and animals (especially birds). Also, as the hotel has only nine rooms in total, you have a lot of privacy. Actually my friend and I have only seen two other guests one time at dinner but had the pool all to ourselves (but we have to say that we have been there during low season). The staff of the hotel is very friendly and attentive. If you have any wishes/needs they are happy to assist you with anything (e.g. the FO manager helped us to book the train from Kandy to Ella). The best feature of the hotel for us was the food, which was included in our room price for 2 nights. For breakfast they have  a Sri Lankan option and a western option (we chose the latter and enjoyed omelette and nice fruits and sweets). Dinner was excellent the two nights. Well-thought 4 course menus that are changing every day, including starter, soup, main course and desert. Every course was a gusto. Also they cook a lot with their own grown plants from the garden and you can really taste the difference between these fresh nutritious meals and the frozen fish and vegetables in Germany.  We really LOVED the food. 
The only thing we would improve is the maintenance of the hotel. The walls, windows and the pool could be cleaner. Also the sun loungers could be renewed as well as the bikes and the roof covers. 
If maintenance and restoration in the hotel would be improved, it is without doubt an amazing place.
Just a little tip on the side: the time we were there it was very windy, especially during the night. The wind was very loud and the roof cover made noises due to the wind. So if you are noise-sensitive and can‚Äôt sleep when it‚Äôs too loud, better bring ear plugs ü´†üôÇ
column13: Very calm place to stay a little outside of dambulla with delicious food and lots of privacy

column12:
Great nature retreat, very comfortable and set in a beautiful complex of untouched nature as well as  food farms. 
We were able to have the karanda suite and it was lovely staying in there. We were able to watch the bats come alive at night and sleep during the day. 
The room itself was fine, kept in a modern style and comfortable. 
A few things that didn‚Äôt work right was the turn down service. Both days we took a trip arranged by the resort and our room was not turned down during the time we were gone. 
We had half board and the food was really good and enjoyable.
column13: Good stay - could have better service

column6: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}
column12:
This is the most awesome place I have stayed. 
Large area of beautifully tended paddy fields, several very different lakes and paths throughout the grounds to walk or cycle. There are 9 rooms across different properties dotted around the grounds. All are very private. 

We stayed  as a family of 4 in the Bakmee  house (upper and lower) . It is right on a lake and the bird life is phenomenal. We had white egret, black headed ibis and hornbills filling 3 of the trees at roosting time only a couple of metres off our decking. The sound was amazing. There were lots of other birds but also water monitors, turtles, huge fruit bats, peacocks ,monkeys‚Ä¶.. and more. 
The building was an amazing architectural piece. We felt very lucky that this was our accommodation as we hadn‚Äôt specifically chosen a room. The building is very modern and nearly  all glass so we felt very close to nature all the time. It is well air conditioned and the rooms are beautiful; glass walled, so looking straight out to nature sitting in bed when the blinds are up.

The whole estate is absolutely stunning. Cycling and walking round was fabulous and so peaceful with lots of wildlife to spot. 
The food is very good with a large menu. The service at dinner was very friendly and attentive. We took breakfast in our house which felt very luxurious. The breakfasts were vast and very tasty. 

The only down side is it needed a good clean. The blinds are old and patterned with squashed insects and we even had a ‚Äòpressed gecko‚Äô! It has the appearance of having had a quick wipe round only rather than cleaning the corners of rooms, behind the sinks, the mirrors etc. There is an unusable outside ?shower or ? Bath. This is not clean at all and was rather unwelcoming. The inside shower is very good though. The huge panes of glass are dirty from the first floor up in the cathedral living area. I appreciate cleaning these higher pane would be hard. The utilities store for the cleaners is enroute to the main entrance of the property ; the door ajar and smells. Several features need some maintenance like faulty electrical blinds and leaking taps. Servicing of the room and clearing breakfast was intermittent and variable and the plunge pool cleaning had to be requested. We were not informed about the full potential of the place - like a separate large swimming pool at the far side of the estate or what activities we could do there- kayaking, lake boat ride etc 

Despite my negative comments above I would be back like a shot as it was the most surreal setting I‚Äôve even been in.
It would be fabulous if the other reviews had been actioned with improvements to the general cleaning and maintenance to showcase this venue to its full potential. 

Come and stay if you like a beautiful,quiet, very different setting,very close to nature.  I suspect the experience would be very different in each of the properties here as they are all very different and situated at different parts of the estate.
column13: Close to nature, a stunning location

Great to stay a few nights to visit Lion‚Äôs Rock, Dambula or even Polonnaruwa. The front desk can arrange all your transportation. Good rooms, great food and as said: super friendly staff. column12:
For all the nature lovers, this hotel provides a unique experience. We stayed in lower bakmee villa which has an awesome lake view from the villa.

The boat ride was decent with good view around the bigger lake and nature walk that u can take with the 110 acre hotel premises.

Book a buggy to roam around the land area if ur going with kids.

The service from the staff is excellent.

column6: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}
column12: I recently stayed at this wonderful eco-friendly hotel and had an amazing experience. The hotel is beautifully designed with sustainability in mind. The rooms were clean and comfortable, and I loved the use of natural materials. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable about their green practices. The food was delicious, with many organic and locally sourced options. Overall, a fantastic stay for anyone who values the environment. Highly recommend!

column6: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}
column12: Excellent stay. We were in the upper bakmee suite, and had a fantastic time. The rooms are spaced out across the property, we were quite close to the main reception / restaurant. Whilst a little further from Dambulla, this wasn‚Äôt a problem for exploring the area with drivers / Tuktuk‚Äôs easily able to come collect us. The vast gardens made for a lovely place to explore after day trips. Special mention to general manager Kanth, who was superb. He made sure we were constantly taken care of and made our trip. The kitchen staff as well were excellent - we most certainly miss the food.
column13: Excellent experience - tranquil location for cultural triangle, with fantastic service

column12: There is beautiful nature all around this peaceful spot. Great food and quick, friendly service.¬†The Bakmee Chalet, where we stayed, had a living room ,dining room and a plunge pool. We could enjoy the outdoors from the comfort of the Chalet because there was so much glass. Without a doubt, I would come back!

column12:
The perfect place to get relaxed, home away from home.

Highlight of the stay was the staff. Beautiful and friendly. The best I saw in the business .

The food was amazing, prepared, and served with love. Service is so so good.

Heavenly peaceful nature.

column6: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}
column10: Make sure you check with the management of the condition of the rooms.
column12:
We picked this hotel to spend the last two days of our 7-day trip in the area, so we were expecting a relaxing and luxurious experience.

We were pleasantly surprised to find that management had upgraded our room from Lower Bakmee to Kumbuk chalet, considering our privacy and the low occupancy during our booking dates.

We found the staff to be very attentive, helpful, and they were eager to make our stay more enjoyable. They also sent us a cake to our room for our anniversary. Special credit goes to the kitchen staff. The food was really delicious and presented beautifully. 

The hotel premises offer many stunning views and we felt like we were living in a village, disconnected from all the busyness outside. As nature lovers, we really enjoyed watching various kinds of birds on the premise and taking walks on the nature trails.

However, we must emphasize that the chalet was not up to a satisfactory level. The bed linens looked old (discolored), and the same goes for the towels as well. The bathroom area was the biggest disappointment. We found it very unpleasant during our stay due to the it‚Äôs dirtiness. Even the plunge pool outside was not clean. 

We believe that unless the management does a proper renovation and deep cleaning of this chalet (Kumbuk chalet) , it should not be given to visitors even at a discounted price. Moreover, the management should explain the condition of the rooms before accepting reservations.

column6: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}
column10: Plunge pools are a must have
column12: One of the most unique experiences I've had in the best possible way. This place combines the tranquil natural setting with effortless luxury.  I was looking for a place to get some clarity and figure somethings in life and this was just the place. Also the food is incredible and the staff is super friendly and helpful.  Pro tip, checkout the fruit farm!

column6: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}
column12:
Honestly I don‚Äôt want to give any spoilers. This is just almost mythical. Appreciate the fact that this resort is not only for the guest, they are just a part of the nature Kalundewa had created. Absolute Gem under the Radar. Inviting all to experience this serenity. Masterpiece. 
The staff is helpful, and simply wonderful. This is coming out of a hotelier him self. 
Thank you, and wishing Kalundewa all the success

column6: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}
column12:
Nestled in a serene and peaceful area, Kalundewa Retreat offers a tranquil retreat away from the hustle and bustle. The staff's hospitality exceeded my expectations, with their attentiveness and warm demeanor enhancing my overall experience. The food surpassed all expectations, with each dish being a culinary masterpiece. Without a doubt, I wholeheartedly recommend for those seeking a tranquil getaway with impeccable service and exceptional dining.

Extra activities: cycling, kayaking 

Unfortunately, all the footage I have are videos and cannot be uploaded :(
column13: Taking peace to a whole new level

column6: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}
column12:
Exceptional experience hidden away in a middle of a small lake and paddy fields. We stayed one night in the Lower Bakmee which includes the private jacuzzi where we spent most of our time. 

Staff were amazing and well experienced. Food was great, we enjoyed each meal served to the room as we requested. 

The only downside is, the rooms need some renovations. Regular cleaning was good but it needs some major deep clean to bring it up to its original glory. 

Overall a great stay in a star class resort.
column13: Great stay in the star class resort

column13: One of a kind room and experience of Nature

column10: There are only nine rooms/chalets on this 110-acre property so book in advance to secure your reservation.
column12: We will remember our stay at this retreat with great fondness. Our room was located in the middle of paddy fields and had a view of the mountains. The operations manager Mr. Samarasiri was extremely warm, welcoming, and attentive to our needs. We enjoyed the food prepared to perfection with vegetables and herbs from the organic garden. If you love birds, this is the place for you. There are several peacocks here that lend beauty to the environment. There can‚Äôt be a better place to unwind and relax.

column6: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}
column12: What can I say about this place, if you want a get away from it all experience in amongst nature then this is the place.  Only 9 rooms scattered over 150 acres of rice fields, lakes and trees.  The rice fields are leased to locals. Lovely walks in complete peace amongst an array of birds and monkeys. At 6pm hundreds of birds descend on the trees in the lakes to bed down for the night, it‚Äôs a sight to be seen and heard. All you can hear are birds, it was a refreshing sound after hearing traffic everyday back home.  Bear in mind you are in fields with nature and nature sometimes pays a visit! The food especially the variety of soups at this retreat were the best we‚Äôve had.

column6: {'id': '5980996', 'name': 'Kalundewa Retreat', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 323, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.796857, 'longitude': 80.67624, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d5980996-Reviews-Kalundewa_Retreat-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.kalundewaretreat.com', 'address': 'Kalundewa Road Dambulu Oya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Kalundewa Road', 'street2': 'Dambulu Oya', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 3, 'count3': 20, 'count4': 54, 'count5': 243}}
column12:
The architecture, the layout of the property is truly special and beautiful. The ethos of blending the hotel into its environs leads to a very special experience. From everywhere in out Chalet we felt like we were outdoor. The people servicing the place are very efficient and good.

However I visited the property after many years and it‚Äôs a bit run down. You expect top notch ‚Äúeverything‚Äù at this cost - but the outdoor shower was dirty. The matter too springy. The sofa covers in the main areas all stained. 
The food was strictly okay 
It‚Äôs in need of an upgradation and re-haul to bring it back to the level of being the best property in Dambulla

column6: {'id': '8655826', 'name': 'Rangiri Dambulla Resort', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 381, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.848332, 'longitude': 80.6345, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d8655826-Reviews-Rangiri_Dambulla_Resort-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://rangiridambullaresort.lsrhotels.com', 'address': 'Pohoran Wewa, Kurunegala Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Pohoran Wewa, Kurunegala Road', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 0, 'count2': 5, 'count3': 8, 'count4': 70, 'count5': 298}}
column12:
We had a nice stay here. 

We received a friendly welcome with fresh juice drinks, flowers and a candle lighting ceremony. 

The resort is set back from the busy road in a peaceful garden oasis. 

There is a large organic garden which the hotel uses for home grown produce. 

We were invited to join a mango tree planting ceremony to celebrate 9 years of business and we were privileged to be part of this. We were shown around the garden, then harvested okra and cassava and had a simple but very tasty lunch cooked with these ingredients in the garden on a simple stove and served wrapped in banana leaf. What a lovely experience! 

The accommodation is a series of lodges around the garden. They are large, clean and comfortable. We did have squirrels in the roof and a few droppings in the room as a consequence but didn‚Äôt find this to be a problem. This was a result of being in area with abundant wildlife which was lovely.

The location is a good base for Dambulla caves and not too far from Sigiriya and national parks for elephant watching.

Dambulla is a busy commercial centre with a 24hr wholesale market - one afternoon my husband ventured in to take a look around for a few hours and returned by tuk tuk. I chose to stay and relax by the pool with our children.

We had a very enjoyable visit to the cricket stadium one evening for the Women‚Äôs T20 Asia cup which happened to be on and offering free entry to promote support. 

The hotel staff were friendly but unfortunately we did find them a little inattentive when we were on site. For example, we spent a fair amount of time relaxing around the pool and no-one came to ask if we wanted drinks or snacks. Of course we could have gone and asked but to be offered would have been nicer and I think reasonable to expect in a higher end hotel, especially as we appeared to be the only guests on site that day! 
Pool towels were not offered until nearly the end if the day. 
In addition pool towels left from other guests on the previous day were not cleared away - I tidied these up myself! I do think the staff may have been distracted by the owner who was visiting that day ü§î but ‚Ä¶. 

Unfortunately I also have to say the food was disappointing. Meals were buffet format. The food was mostly cold and quite bland. We ate out for 2 out of the 3 nights due to this - there is quite a good restaurant just a few hundred metres up the road. 

Finally - a poor touch as we checked out was a staff member following my husband to the tip box to ensure he made a tip and then signalling to colleagues how much he‚Äôd placed in the box. Not very polite and certainly not classy!

Overall I can say we had an enjoyable and relaxing stay in a peaceful garden oasis. The staff were kind and friendly but there‚Äôs a bit of room for improvement in a few areas.
column13: A nice resort hotel with peaceful garden. Staff friendly. Unfortunately food not great.

column12: The staff went out of their way to make it a special experience. Super friendly and attentive, fixed issues quickly, super food, and even some fascinating cultural experiences too (eg staff showing us traditional dance and letting us take part in food preparation). Lots of wildlife to see on-site too. A great base for local adventures. The elephant safari is amazing and the cricket stadium is very close (we saw a Lankan premier league match). Fairly limited onsite facilities for children - there is an outdoor pool - but the staff played cricket with us, which was a real highlight for the kids. Overall lots of lovely memories and left feeling like royalty.
column13: The staff make it a wonderful experience

column12: If you want somewhere quiet, immersed in nature with lovely food and the friendliest staff, who make you feel at home, try a stay here. column12:
Very good stay in this hotel. What impressed us the most was not the room although it was huge and very well decorated, with its very comfortable king size bed. It's not the swimming pool, nor the restaurant. It's not the wifi which we couldn't get in our bungalow. 

What really impressed us was that the staff made us feel like we were the most important people in the world. We have stayed in many hotels but never have we had so much attention from the staff, from the bouquet of flowers upon arrival to the blessing upon departure.

Thank you Dinesh and thank you to your entire team.

Rina and Patrick
column13: Le personnel le plus attentionn√© jamais rencontr√© !

column12:
Good hotel overall. 

Rooms were nice looking and all electronics worked properly.

Staff is very friendly and the food is of good quality and variety. Make sure you bring the exact amount of money for paying your drinks however because change seems to always be taken as tip by the waiter. Unless you don‚Äôt mind him taking the change as tip, we didn‚Äôt mind it too much since it was little but still weird they didn‚Äôt ask if it was okay.

Be prepared for a lot of insects, they‚Äôre everywhere. We had at least 20 insects entering our room even tho we tried to block any gaps in the windows / doors with towels and anything we could find. If you hate bugs it‚Äôs best to avoid.
column13: Good hotel if you don‚Äôt mind bugs

Overall, a wonderful experience we would love to repeat.

Great place with very nice and attentive staff. You need to stay there. Place is nice and comfortable, full of trees and green, surrounded by a paddy field - more green - easy travel to lot of attractions and peaceful. Food is very tasty.  
But for locals: don't expect a good buffet, it is very limited and items are very much like what you make at home.

column12:
We stayed for 2 nights as a base to visit Sigiriya and the Dambulla caves. Very good location for both.
Highlights: friendly staff, super buffet, airy rooms with shaded balconies and a relaxing view over the paddy fields. 
No big tour groups and a wide variety of visitors. 
We also loved the spa massages. Don‚Äôt let the location near a road put you off.  Not intrusive at all and all very quiet in the hotel.

column12:
Charming village retreat! Cozy rooms, friendly staff, and Impeccable service. Embrace the simplicity and warmth. A delightful escape from city life. Our room, adorned with rustic decor, exuded comfort and simplicity. The view from our window overlooked the serene village landscape, creating a peaceful ambiance. The bed was plush, ensuring a restful night's sleep after a day of exploring the nearby attractions. Our time here was a refreshing blend of comfort, simplicity, and the beauty of village life. If you seek a tranquil retreat with authentic village charm, this hotel is a gem waiting to be discovered. 
Highly recommend!

column12: Anybody knows those ruin - bars in Budapest? This place's atmosphere is similar to them, but in a tropical surroundings in Sri Lanka. Here everything is possible. If you want drink a cocktail while sitting in the pool, even late at night, if you want to choose a mild curry or a hot - as - a - hell one, one thing is sure: the staff will do everything for your sake! They are ready for a chat anytime, a friendly, youth - hearted place!

column6: {'id': '2372292', 'name': 'Sundaras Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1335, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.854837, 'longitude': 80.652466, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d2372292-Reviews-Sundaras_Resort_Spa-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.sundaras.com/', 'address': '189 Kandy Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '189 Kandy Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 71, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 146, 'count4': 248, 'count5': 802}}
column12:
As a group of 4, we decided to go for dinner at the Sundaras resort. The staff really looked after us, the food was good and the beer cold.
In chatting with Siddu, about the best things to do, we ended up booking two tours, the sunrise walk up Pidurangala rock and an afternoon elephant safari. Even though we were staying at a different hotel, he arranged pickup etc. all at a really good price.
We were picked up from our hotel at 5.45 prompt both TK our guide and proceeded to Pidurangala rock, admission was 1000 or 2000LKR each. The climb was steps at first and some serious scrambling near the top. The walk, with maybe 1000 others, including rests and queuing for the difficult parts took about 30 to 40 mins. TK did the walk with us and helped us and others along the way. At the top we had the most spectacular views of sunrise and lion rock, the walk back in daylight was easier than going up in the dark.
Following on, we had a really nice breakfast in a small 'locals' restaurant and then visited the reservoir, dropped back at our accommodation. TK was fantastic as a guide and a person .
Next was the elephant safari, Thilina our guide and driver was excellent, he was very safe a careful, knowledgeable and took many short detours to places he thought the elephants may be. In total we saw 48 elephants, some only a few weeks old, to the very big ones. It was a fantastic trip, with a great guide / driver. Highly recommend this tour, it was 6 hours of pleasure and learning.
We got back to our hotel to find a couple who had been quoted more for the two of them to do the safari than we paid for four people for the both trips.
Needless to s at we returned the next day to eat and drink at the Sundaras.
Thank you Siddu, TK and Thilina
column13: The best food drink and excursions

column6: {'id': '2372292', 'name': 'Sundaras Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1335, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.854837, 'longitude': 80.652466, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d2372292-Reviews-Sundaras_Resort_Spa-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.sundaras.com/', 'address': '189 Kandy Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '189 Kandy Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 71, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 146, 'count4': 248, 'count5': 802}}
column12: A really lovely vibe at this place, with a great pool area with rustic seating areas and lots of trees around. Fantastic location for the nearby Dambulla Cave Temple. Very friendly and helpful staff, tasty meals and comfortable rooms with great spacious balconies. Just two things needed for five star review - mosquito repellent in rooms and a generator needed for occasional power cuts, which happened once during our stay. But overall, highly recommended.

His attentive service and willingness to go above and beyond ensured that every aspect of our visit was enjoyable. The resort itself exuded charm and tranquility, with lush surroundings and well-appointed accommodations. The amenities provided were top-notch, catering to every need and indulgence. The best place to get your rest in lushy greens after a visit to sigiriya, polonnaruwa or dambulla. Very kind staff, awesome swimming Pool, good food and the first bar (plus good music) we crossed in Sri Lanka.

column6: {'id': '2372292', 'name': 'Sundaras Resort & Spa', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 1335, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.854837, 'longitude': 80.652466, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d2372292-Reviews-Sundaras_Resort_Spa-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.sundaras.com/', 'address': '189 Kandy Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '189 Kandy Road', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 71, 'count2': 68, 'count3': 146, 'count4': 248, 'count5': 802}}
column10: It‚Äôs a half built resort
column12:
We didn‚Äôt stay here but went for a few beers after looking at their website. 
The bar area is dilapidated, we did not use the pool as filtration system was turned off and only turned on when a few more people turned up. 
We asked for a drinks menu and were told we would have to wait for the bar person who then turned up and stated he didn‚Äôt have one. When I asked the price he said you will have to pay at reception so never got a price until I went to reception. They only thought we had had 4 beers but being honest I said no it was 6, ¬£25 later I wish I had kept my mouth shut. Honesty can sometimes be a double edge sword. 
It‚Äôs certainly not 4star even at Sri Lanka standards

column6: {'id': '649489', 'name': 'Sigiriana Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 851, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.822019, 'longitude': 80.654755, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d649489-Reviews-Sigiriana_Resort-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://sigirianaresort.com/', 'address': '51 Godawalayaya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '51 Godawalayaya', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 38, 'count2': 31, 'count3': 104, 'count4': 306, 'count5': 372}}
column12: It was a long walk to our room in one of the villas through lovely gardens with signs giving information about the plants. The room was showing its age and lack of cleaning. Some of the powerpoints looked grubby as did some tiles/grouting in the bathroom. Towels were off-white (as were the sheets) and far from new. At least the hot water was really hot. The door to the patio didn‚Äôt close completely, so no wonder there were insects in the room. One chair on the patio was missing a slat so it couldn‚Äôt be sat on comfortably. The food was good. We couldn‚Äôt see the point in having dinner on the BBQ terrace (grass) when it was not a barbeque. The final straw was being shown to a breakfast table with crumbs on the plate and tablecloth. When I complained, we were shown to another table with not only crumbs but stains from the previous night‚Äôs dinner. While this table was cleaned no attempt was made to clean the first one. We were at breakfast early, so we knew the tables had not been cleaned from the previous night.

column6: {'id': '649489', 'name': 'Sigiriana Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 851, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.822019, 'longitude': 80.654755, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d649489-Reviews-Sigiriana_Resort-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://sigirianaresort.com/', 'address': '51 Godawalayaya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '51 Godawalayaya', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 38, 'count2': 31, 'count3': 104, 'count4': 306, 'count5': 372}}
column12: During my visit to Sri Lanka, I stayed at various hotels, but this one stood out as one of the best. From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed with fresh-smelling wet towels and refreshing mango juice. The rooms were impeccably clean, and the staff were exceptionally kind and friendly, attending to our requests promptly. The variety of delicious food was impressive. The hotel is situated in a quiet area, surrounded by extensive gardens and greenery. I definitely recommend it!
column13: Unforgettable Hotel Stay in Sri Lanka

column6: {'id': '649489', 'name': 'Sigiriana Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 851, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.822019, 'longitude': 80.654755, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d649489-Reviews-Sigiriana_Resort-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://sigirianaresort.com/', 'address': '51 Godawalayaya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '51 Godawalayaya', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 38, 'count2': 31, 'count3': 104, 'count4': 306, 'count5': 372}}
column12:
This was our favourite hotel of the trip! Our family of 4 were separated into two huge rooms by a balcony so we were easily able to spend time in each others rooms. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. 
We used the swimming pool on a couple of occasions and my children enjoyed watching the birds and widlife whilst in the water! I indulged in a spa treatment that was also very nice. 
The restaurant had plenty to choose from and also had wonderful views over the paddy fields. Plenty of wildlife to spot including giant squirrels, Lizards, palm squirrels and birds. 
Thank you so much for a wonderful start to our holiday!

column6: {'id': '649489', 'name': 'Sigiriana Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 851, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.822019, 'longitude': 80.654755, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d649489-Reviews-Sigiriana_Resort-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://sigirianaresort.com/', 'address': '51 Godawalayaya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '51 Godawalayaya', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 38, 'count2': 31, 'count3': 104, 'count4': 306, 'count5': 372}}
column12: The resort is beautiful, the greenery that surrounds us provides a very soothing feeling. We have merged with nature. You need to see it and feel.

column6: {'id': '649489', 'name': 'Sigiriana Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 851, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.822019, 'longitude': 80.654755, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d649489-Reviews-Sigiriana_Resort-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://sigirianaresort.com/', 'address': '51 Godawalayaya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '51 Godawalayaya', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 38, 'count2': 31, 'count3': 104, 'count4': 306, 'count5': 372}}
column12:
Excellent stay that was. Had many options to enjoy. The villa was exceptional, because it gives enough space and a calm environment. 
Staff members were really helpful and friendly.  If someone is looking for a peaceful stay, this  would be ideal place to look for.
column13: Many good reasons to have a stay!!

column6: {'id': '649489', 'name': 'Sigiriana Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 851, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.822019, 'longitude': 80.654755, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d649489-Reviews-Sigiriana_Resort-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://sigirianaresort.com/', 'address': '51 Godawalayaya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '51 Godawalayaya', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 38, 'count2': 31, 'count3': 104, 'count4': 306, 'count5': 372}}
column12: the hotel is superb, very well located near the tourist attractions. located in an oasis of peace sorrounded with mango trees. in the morning you wake up with the song of the birds, and the jumping from one tree to another of the goofy and the lovely squirrels. very good food, both local and international. very nice staff.

column6: {'id': '649489', 'name': 'Sigiriana Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 851, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.822019, 'longitude': 80.654755, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d649489-Reviews-Sigiriana_Resort-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://sigirianaresort.com/', 'address': '51 Godawalayaya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '51 Godawalayaya', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 38, 'count2': 31, 'count3': 104, 'count4': 306, 'count5': 372}}
column12:
Helpful staff, grounds and facilities lovely. 
WiFi not good though if you need to do more than check e-mails. 
Breakfast , everything you could want but evening buffet very basic and as there are a lot of big tour groups not a great place to eat.
column13: Comfortable place to stay but a lot of big groups

column6: {'id': '649489', 'name': 'Sigiriana Resort', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 851, 'locationString': 'Dambulla, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.822019, 'longitude': 80.654755, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304133-d649489-Reviews-Sigiriana_Resort-Dambulla_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://sigirianaresort.com/', 'address': '51 Godawalayaya, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '51 Godawalayaya', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Dambulla', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '21100'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 38, 'count2': 31, 'count3': 104, 'count4': 306, 'count5': 372}}
column12:
This property is the same as 'Sigiriana Resort by Thilanka'. The staff were warm and hospitable. Room was spacious and had a nice view of the garden from the balcony. Food was average and can definitely be better.  Was disappointed to see no vegetarian desserts (other than papaya, watermelon & guava) & when I pointed this to the chef, he was kind enough to arrange something for me - a mango : )
The pool, as mentioned by several others, is the highlight.

column5:
{'id': '978488968', 'text': "Dear Sir/Madam,

Thank you so much for your kind words about Nice Place Resort Dambulla! We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your stay and found our staff friendly and helpful. It‚Äôs fantastic to know that our culinary team could adjust the spice levels to your liking and that you loved our seafood dish!

We‚Äôre also delighted that you had a memorable experience with our owner's pet squirrel‚Äîit's always a joy to connect with our guests through special moments like that.

We completely understand about the photos and hope you find your phone soon! If you do manage to upload any pictures, we‚Äôd love to see them.

Thank you once again for recommending us. We hope to welcome you back for another enjoyable stay in the future!

Best regards,

Nice Place Resort Management
Dambulla

column10: Try being nice to other people then they will treat you nicely
column12:
This place lives up to its name. Actually, a Nice Place. I would highly recommend here because the staff was friendly and helpful and the food was great (I wanted a little bit less spice and they gave me the perfect amount and u have to try the seafood dish although it was too big for 1 person, I still ate it because it's just so good, and the son of the hotel's owner had a pet squirrel which was soo cute I loved the experience and you will too!
P.S - I won't be able to upload photos because I lost the phone I had the pictures with at the beach. (If I find the pictures I'll upload it)
column13: Top 5 Best Hotels I Have Ever Been To!

column12:
What a fantastic place - it was like a retreat resort outside of Dambulla, from here you could visit the Sigirya Rock Fortress, Dambulla Cave Temple or go on a safari.  

Back at the hotel it felt like there was nobody else around. 

The staff were amazing, we even got taken on our own personal birdwatching bushwalk around the local village.

We had a gathering at nice place in April 2024. It was really a great stay. Staff are friendly and courteous. We had a party at poolside all over the night (it‚Äôs not disturbing to other guests since the pool is away from rooms) and a staff member was there always to cater our needs.

Mr. Chaminda and Mr. Ajith has coordinated well with our team to give their best. Rooms are clean and well maintained. Food was more than expected and well worth for the price.

Overall it‚Äôs a great experience for very reasonable price

column10: Leave your greetings  on the graffiti wall.
column12: We had a good stay during road trip in feb 2024 in one of the simple rooms. The food was nice , the bar (Good cocktails and beer.) was lovely and the staff was friendly and entertaining.  Check the graffiti on the walls in lounge and bar, many people had a good time there.

column12: Stayed for 2 nights in a tree house room. The room was surrounded by beautiful nature. Staff was so friendly and accommodating. The property was so relaxing - just sitting in the lobby was serene. Buffet  included with room was a nice treat. Definitely recommend !

column12: Nice place is located so close to nature and helped us to relax and take a much needed break from the routine. It‚Äôs located within a few minutes reach to Dambulla and Sigiriya. I recommend the tree houses, they were quite an experience, and we are missing it already! The pool was quite large with a kids pool as well. The staff kind and helpful, food was great buffet, and I‚Äôd say it was an unforgettable memory we had there. I‚Äôd like to thank the manager and staff for their kind hospitality. Nice place‚Ä¶ Nice indeed.
